ESSA √â A MINHA OPINI√ÉO, SINTA-SE LIVRE PARA COMPRAR OU N√ÉO. JOGUE O JOGO E VEJA POR SI MESMO, OBRIGADO POR LER. TENHA UM BOM JOGO.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969537889', 'num_games_owned': 3355, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1510518687}
review:
If you're after something like Zelda then this is not it. It is basically a collection of fetch quests. The power ups you collect don't make any real difference.

The counters for many of the achievements are bugged so don't take them as gospel. I had achievements trigger that I clearly had not completed.

The world itself has charm but feels very sectioned and restricted. It has small blasts of originality but the areas are too similar. There isn't really anything distinctive about them.

It's also very repetitive and the final achievements are a real grind and lazy. Do you really need to kick a thousand vases?

It all sounds negative but I enjoyed the first play through. However, I was glad to be done with it in the end.

I got my money's worth but do feel that it could have been so much better with a just a bit more polish and variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042771716', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1505750098}
review: A relaxing, beautiful and surprisingly funny game. Also weirdly dark for a game that looks so cute. It's basically about slavery, cannibalism and mind control. Also, the game recognizes when you do things in the wrong order, which is neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104496074', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1505330480}
review: Lili:Child of Geos is pretty nice and interesting adventure story. It have good visuals and easy gameplay which is not based on violence, you just need to pick flowers to defeat enemy. This game is full of kindness,yep. It it also have some funny references and rare mature-humor. Unfortunately the game is short. I beat it in about 8hrs, but there is free-mode after end thought. I recommend this game for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084995982', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1503470022}
review: Lili: Child of Geos is a really cute little game.  The graphics and gameplay aren't bad for an indie title, though the fights with spirits can get a little repetitive.  The storyline is interesting, the random characters you encounter are varied and well thought out and there are a few side quests to get through as well.  If you like collecting things in-game, you will enjoy this one!  Replayability is not really there, there are a few mistakes in dialogue and it is quite short, but otherwise it's a charming, fun game which I really enjoyed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060165922', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1501970895}
review: I was able to beat this game in one sitting. Very silly, adult humor in kid-game setting. Good for a laugh. Probably better played on mobile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143034343', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1498088500}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is light-hearted and good for a short casual play. It's a delightful adventure game about a student who needs to collect interesting flowers for her thesis, and she decides to go to the land of Geos to find legendary species. Upon arrival, Lili finds herself thrown into a peculiar society of Constructs and Spirits, where all Constructs are enslaved by the Mayor, a Spirit. Lili decides that saving the Constructs from tyranny is more important than securing her degree, and stays to help defeat the Mayor.

The game revolves around picking flowers; defeating the Spirits require you to jump on their backs and remove their red flower. I was a bit hesitant to buy this game because of the story's premise, but the wonderful graphics and music are evidence of the game's overall great quality. It is definitely worth joining Lili on her adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035644453', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 328, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1484170931}
review: While the art style & characters are charming, the gameplay consists of walking & quick-time events. Seems too restrictive & simplistic for me. Maybe it becomes more interesting later? I'm not sure. But the start of the game just didn't "grab me".

author: {'steamid': '76561198319845730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1495480916}
review: I enjoyed the simplicity of this game. It is a generally quick play once you understand what it is you are meant to do, but the game can be stretched out a bit if you work on completing the steam achievments after completing the main objective of the game. Graphics were nice, and some of the dialogue was humourous. Coins are easy to collect, and if you enjoy running around and collecting or breaking things, you're in luck. There is also no death or realistic violence in this game. It was overall, very cute.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969656754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1495350873}
review:
This wasn't a terrible game, just not really for me. For kids or casual players who are just getting intio games, I would reccomend it highly.

The graphics and animations are vibrant and smoth with solid controls. Some decent humor and interesting characters. Most of the game consists of defeating spirits by chasing them and jumping on them to pick flowers out of their heads in a mini-game that is kind of like Simon. If that sounds appealing to you, by all means get this game because, other than fetch quests and exploring, thats really all there is to it. You beat the game when you beat the Mayor spirit of the island. Not much replay value but I didn't finish everything. Not much incentive to after beating the last boss besides just acheivements.

6.5/10

review:
I've been playing the game for about an hour and I completely love it. The references and jokes give me a warm feeling in my heart. At first I was nitpicking about the turning animation and the different controls. But I've forgotten about them completely and have gotten fully immersed in this world of Geos. 
I don't know about the later parts of the game yet, but as of right now I give it 100/100.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293684403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1490557526}

author: {'steamid': '76561198140564466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1489970839}
review:
Beautiful visual and interesting storyline. It's a relaxing game really, where you can just take your time and explore the areas (which each has its own unique charm...especially the 2nd area, Splitwood, it gave me the Twlight town vibe from KH2). The characters are adorable and unique and speak silly nonsense at times, one even offers game trivias. The gameplay become quite repeatitive after some time, but there are some mini side quests if you just want to take a break from chasing spirits.
Overall, it's a fun and beautiful relaxing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043491249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1489374223}
review: Actually beautiful and spirited game. I really hope the group is taking more steps for another game, and particularly in an even more professional (though with the same spirit!) sort of feel to it. Though the indie scene has been spoiled by some bad sports in the recent years, these guys have managed to create THE ideal indie game. I had a great time with it, and am glad to support these folks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056886572', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1482872083}
review: A fun little game to waste 8-10 hours. It feels more like a phone/tablet game (which was the original intention),  but prettier, and will probably appeal more to casual gamers. There's not a lot of content, and the gameplay is repetitive, but it works for the context and length of game. It is definitely not for everyone, but at a low price, it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108852006', 'num_games_owned': 9325, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1489509474}
review:
Very cute and interesting game. There's some exploration, flower picking and spirit 'fighting' to do. The graphics have their own style and look nice. The game is quite repetitive though and the story is pretty simple, but the characters and the small quests that you have to do keep it quite interesting for the few hours that you'll play.

Overall a pretty unique idea and also pretty well made. Maybe a bit short for a tenner, but certainly worth picking up during a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046418282', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1695322255}
review:
Just relax...

Pro
- good graphics
- good gameplay mechanics
- nice simple relatable story
- funny characters
- soundtrack (gets a little boring after a while)

Con
- keys can only be changed editing the configuration file, that is bad game design
- no voice acting, it has a little but is just a glimpse of what it could have been
- could of had more achievements for finishing the game on other difficulties (not really a con i know)
- too much nonsensical commentaries from npc's, more story would have been better

7/10 rating , i was hooked to play 13h straight, it was very relaxing for me.

review:
Ein sehr sch√∂nes, kurzes Spiel f√ºr zwischendurch. 

Das Game ist aus meiner Sicht einfach sch√∂n designed und trotz mancher Anzeigefehler und Glitches ist es durchaus genie√übar. Die Hauptstory ist nicht sonderlich fesselnd und auch wirklich eher kurz und knapp, aber gl√ºcklicherweise gibt es die Sidequests, die auch noch ein bisschen Freude mit sich bringen. 

 Im Gro√üen und Ganzen bin ich recht schnell durchs Spiel gekommen, kann mir aber durchaus vorstellen, dass wenn man alle Errungenschaften ergattern m√∂chte, auch wohl ein bisschen mehr Zeit ins Spiel investiert. 

Die einzigen M√§ngel, die mir so ein bisschen den Spielspa√ü nahmen, waren zum einen die Musik, die mit der Zeit doch recht nervig wurde und zum anderen, f√ºr die lesefaulen, dass die Charaktere keine Stimmen haben. 

Ansonsten war ich rund um zufrieden mit dem Spiel und kann es als "Kurzes Game f√ºr Zwischendurch" durchaus empfehlen.

review: Decent game... worth 5$ to kill an evening.  Had no sound and i didnt diag so im not sure what the issue was (NO it wasnt a volume issue). its a simple and short game designed for children i assume. graphics are pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993078466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1484701302}
review:
A charming colourful world and gameplay that gets very stale and repetitive after about twenty minutes, as you just play the same minigame over and over without much story or motivation. Even for a short, indie budget game, it's barebones. It also has the most abrupt opening I've seen in a long time, that actually made me restart the game because I thought it had accidentally skipped the intro. The world is really pretty to look at, though.
Also it goes way overboard on the "wacky", out of place videogame references. It's not funny or cute if you do it every other freaking minute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085675458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1483463037}
review:
i already  beat the game,  but it seems that steam  did  count my playing timebecause i was offline.

what i like about this game  is the beautiful design of everything in this game.  some complain that the game  is too short, but  for me is the  perfect game to beat without committing much of my time.   you have to collect flowers  to unlock the next part of the island.  the developer  really conscious that they are in casual gamers market, because  there are two ways to collect the numbers  of flowers required. 1. you can jump on the back of enemies to  collect their  flowers, this require skills and you can fail because the enemies can also grow bombs and thorns on their back.  2. for those who don't have enough time,  there is alternative way of  collecting flowers by doing simple fetch quests.

at first i was worried that this is a kiddie game  because of the bright colors and  cheerful atmosphere.  fortunately  the developers kinda solved this problem   by making lili  a college kid who arrived to the island to do important class assignment.  fear of flunking  the class  is always on the back of her mind. so she  has to weigh her choices carefully. the dialogues are not just happy go lucky

 what i dislike. 

possible spoiler

i won't recommend  this game  to parents who are looking for games for their young children. because there is  an option for lili to  not submit  her assignment and to quit school to live the life of an adventurer

author: {'steamid': '76561198119213547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1531555732}

author: {'steamid': '76561198250240500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1483483006}
review:
Get it for the graphics and relaxation - gameplay is just collecting stuff and walking around. If you want something more involved, look elsewhere.

Update: The length of the game is just perfect. I found myself reaching the end just as I was getting tired of it. The interactions with the characters are all funny and interesting. The story is not deep and the enemy just falls into the stereotype of a "jerk" that you're supposed to feel bad okay pulling flowers off of the backs off. As long as you're not expecting award-winning plot you can find something to like here.

review:
A game that you want to give your daughter <3

Everything packaged with good humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197918528', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1617781440}
review:
If you need a break from reality and you like to hit the <PAUSE> Botton on your troubled brain. 
Lili: Child of Geos is sooo the place to go!

I really liked this as a getaway. Maybe it sounds silly but collecting flowers once in a while isn¬¥t a bad throphy to strive for. 
It¬¥s a simple but nice story with very likeable fairytale like NPCs. To be honest, I¬¥m not one of those players that need high end graphics, so with that being said: I really like the graphics off this game. 

But there are two Con-Points on my part:

1st: The Music is kinda repetitiv and can spoil the overall relaxation (which I found in the game). Luckily it can be turned off.

2nd: I have a different understanding of full controller support in a game. It¬¥s not that the game does not tell you straight up the allocations of the controller, thats ok. BUT, the forgott to allocate the <WALK> Botton. ;0)
So, after you leveled up your speed, it¬¥s kinda "Running Only".


I would recommend the game, not only for kids but also for those who need a break from ..(let¬¥s say) Doom or other more thrilling AAA Games.

review: Beautiful game (soundtrack and visuals), the story is real easy to get into, and the dialogue can be nice and quirky at times. The only issue I had at first was with the camera not following your curser instantaneously and instead it had a slight panning animation to it so it would lag a little, but I got used to it very quickly. The achievements are also pretty straight forward with only a few of them requiring just a little bit of grinding (namely the "collectables"). Hard to believe this was brought over from mobile to pc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047339888', 'num_games_owned': 1050, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1630098798}
review:
Love this game ! 

So much win, good story, lots of humor, the constructs always have something witty to say, and playing Lili is a lot of fun. The world looks amazing, so much color and very creative while keeping great frame rate and no lag. There are plenty of quests to go on, and they aren't long and drawn out, just long enough to keep you entertained before moving on to the next one. 
It's also a nice break from all the violence and brutal deaths in most of the other games i play...i love that sort of thing but it's nice to have something relaxing to play that will give me a good laugh, it is also suitable for children to play as well in my opinion. They can also have fun with all of Lili's outfits you can buy for her. The controls are fairly simple as well.

I don't like writing long reviews, i know they may not be to helpful, but i hope it's enough to convince you to buy this game, it's a ton of fun and family friendly...great for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041357139', 'num_games_owned': 2753, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1612598728}
review:
It's simple, it's a collect-a-thon, and it takes place in a lovely, brightly-coloured world. It's also one of the darkest worlds you'll ever set foot in. What first seems harmless and cute turns out to be truly evil, while the evil just gets more sinister. Throughout the game all I did was doom a peaceful and moderately oppressed people to fire, famine, and bloodshed. Truly at the end of this game (if it can even be called a 'game') you will feel nothing more than wicked.

If you're looking for a game about being evil, this is it. Just because it's non-violent doesn't mean you're going to finish with a clean conscience. 

In short, this is the game everyone should get. It teaches valuable life lessons about how much having good intentions matter in the face of actions. It should be part of every school's curriculum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024902264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1511382297}
review:
Man sollte wissen: Es kommt aus dem Mobile-Bereich. Dies MERKT man auch.
Die Steuerung ist aber ganz gut angepasst. Die Grafik ebenfalls.

Ich habe anfangs nicht gewusst, dass es aus dem Moible-Bereich kommt und habe es auch bis zum ersten Gegner nicht gemerkt. Dennoch ist die Story witzig und die Nebenaufgaben lustig. Ein wahrer renner ist es jedoch nicht...

Vorteile:
+ Lustige Story
+ Lustige Charaktere
+ Gut angepasst (Andere Mobile-Ports sind gelinde gesagt MIES angepasst)
+ Grafik ist auch der Story entspechend.
+ Erkundschaften einer interessanten Welt.

Neutral:
# Irgendwie fehlt mir hier eine vollst√§ndige Vertonung :D (W√§re bestimmt lustig)
# Einfache Mechanik (Ist halt ein Mobileport)
# "Outfits" und "Upgrades" etc sind jetzt nicht gerade wegweisend und eher nett.

Negativ:
- Einfache/Geduld/Farming Achievments
- Kurzes Spiel (Ist halt ein Mobileport)

author: {'steamid': '76561198299548827', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1599941237}
review:
This game is honestly really, really cute, and quite entertaining at times. The plot is decent, the gameplay is pretty fun, and the world looks absolutely beautiful... but there's one big issue that might be a potential deal-breaker for some people.

I have an Alienware 13 with an Intel i7-5500U processor (2.40GHz), an Nvidia 960M GPU with the latest drivers, and 16GB of RAM. When I'm using the game's "Low" graphics setting, I can get only just above 30fps if I stand still and stare at a wall. If I use the game's "Highest" graphics setting and I'm moving a lot or generally trying to play the game, I can easily end up with less than 10fps. (For comparison, my computer can easily and consistently get anywhere from 120-150fps in Portal 2 without even breaking a sweat.) I have no idea if the problem is with the game or my computer (though I'd be very, very surprised if it was the latter), but this definitely needs to be mentioned, and hopefully fixed.

Other than that, this game is a great experience and a lot of fun, considering that it's a PC port/expansion of a tablet game. Though I was a bit disappointed when I had to play on the "Low" or "Medium" graphics settings to have a framerate better than "slideshow", I didn't really notice it after a while and was simply able to enjoy the game for what it was.

The other thing I'm slightly disappointed by - though in a good way - is that there isn't any way to get the soundtrack! The background music is all really nice and calm for the most part, with simple instrumentation and nice melodies. If there was a $1.99 DLC I'd buy it in a heartbeat.

[b]TL;DR:[/b] If the very thought of getting less than 60fps makes you want to throw up and/or throw your computer out a window, I wouldn't recommend this game. For everyone else, though, it's definitely worth at least waiting for a sale - this game is really cute and fun, and it's got a pretty decent price for the five or so hours of playtime.

{'steamid': '76561198073526834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1511431706}
review:
Man, what an utterly delightful and enjoyable little game! 

I picked this up during a summer sale as more of an afterthought, but when I started playing it, I was pleasantly surprised at what this game has to offer. Expect to explore every corner of a vibrant island village, complete quests, meet odd but charismatic characters and find collectibles. With the help of pretty graphics and lovely music, the above made for a very pleasant experience. Even 100%-ing the Steam Achievements was fun.

One thing I noticed about this game is that although this game may seem like a sugar-coated, child-friendly game (which it is), there is enough grown-up humour and pop-culture references hidden throughout the game to maintain appeal to a grown-ass man such as myself.

So whether you are looking for a birthday gift for your 10-year-old niece, or you just need a peaceful break from violently carving up a million orks in Mordor, this game is suitable for either option. Give it a try! It's hard to be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041187156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1474912120}
review:
A cute and fun adventure game for someone looking for something a little different.

Graphics: 10/10. Everything looks absolutely gorgeous.

Sounds: 8/10. Solid sound effects, pleasant to listen to and add to the ambience.

Music: 10/10. Calm, relaxing, and fits the carefree adventerous spirit of the game.

Story: 9/10. A pretty good story overall; I don't want to spoil anything though. The characters have a good bit of personality, and you can find items with random bits of lore attached to them all over.

Gameplay: 8/10. A solid core of exploration, and the spirit wrangling minigame is pretty fun. Somewhat gameplay-light, but it fits the game well. My only real complaint is that the white flowers you collect don't really do all that much... you can turn them into keys (rendered obsolete as soon as you get the Skeleton Key, which you can do pretty early), sell them for money, or gamble them for a potentially larger amount of money. I was kind of hoping that they'd do more than that.

Overall: 10/10. A short game, but a really fun one.

A quick note: While the game is mostly kid-friendly, there are a few moments of subtly racy humor here and there. It's nothing a kid would really get though, so it's probably not a major worry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297793792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1474214774}
review: Enjoyable game to while away a lazy Sunday afternoon. Gameplay and story very straight forward. Consists mainly of running around talking to characters to get quests, picking up items, and taking down the 50 Spirit enemies which are found throughout the game. Combat consists of a QTE sequence in which you have to press buttons that pop up on screen, later in the game the QTE's get more difficult. Extremely easy achievements, you can get them all in about 5-6 hours. Works great on Windows 10, supports gamepad though on screen tutorials are not entirely written for someone who is playing with a controller, but this will not stop you enjoying the game. All in all, a good game. Pick it up cheap if you can as once you've finished it, there's not much calling you back to play it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120501296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1473874309}
review:
First off, I did get this on sale at $5, but I loved it so much I purchased a second copy for my sister.


Lili is a wonderful litle game, I gotta say. The art style is fantastic, everything looks so vibrant and full of life. That's actually the main reason I bought it. However, the fantastic scenery isn't the best part. Lili's cast of characters are quirky and unique, all with plenty of soul about them. There wasn't every a single time when I could say I was bored with this game.

Now, that being said, the developers did say it was originally going to be a tablet game, and you can tell. While that is by no means a bad thing, it may throw some people off.

Another thing is, holy moly, the music is fantastic. Each zone has its own original track that plays throughout that just sounds wonderful, in addition to a few other tracks you'll hear when fighting a boss or entering a room.

Each zone is crafted in such a way that is unique from the others, but still fits the over all feel of the game, filled with its own "Constructs" (the wooden robot like inhabitants of Geos) that all have things they need help with, and with malicious spirits that need a good clobbering.

One thing I will say, and this may be a negative to some, and a positive to others, but this game is incredibly easy, once you have the controls down. Like I said, it was originally supposed to be a mobile phone/tablet game, so it takes a bit of getting used to on keyboard and mouse, I'm not sure how it feels on controllers. It gets especially easy with the addition of power ups and items.

One final thing as well, the game can run very well even on older systems. I purchased a copy for my sister as well as myself, and her gameplay looked identical to mine, and she's using a 9 year old Nvidia GTS250 graphics card and an Intel G3258 processor, and she had no issues at max settings. So, props to the developers for optimizing their game so well.

Pros: 
Fantastic scenery 
Wonderful OST
Fun characters 
Fun "combat"

Cons:
Relatively short game
Pretty easy, although to some that may not be a bad thing.

all in all, for what it is, I love this game and highly recomend it.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198141565612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1473554623}
review:
I finished the game the same day I bought it. The main storyline is fairly short, but quirky and adorable. Each Construct is unique in some way, and I was never bored. The 'fighting' mechanic is unique and interesting, and I found it to be very enjoyable. The soundtrack is absolutely perfect, the visuals blew me away, and even with my crappy 10 year old GC, it ran like a dream on the highest settings.

If you are like me, someone who feels compelled to break every pot and whatnot, then you won't find the repetative collecting annoying. Flower picking sim at it's finest, but I enjoyed it. I actually went through and got 3 stars on very single Spirit. 

The nods to Zelda and the one LOTR reference I thoroughly enjoyed, though I wish the underlying cannabalism story had been touched on more. 

All in all, this is by far one of the best indie games I have played in a long time. 10/10 would reccomend would play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067792321', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1473384152}
review: I wasn't sure about this game, but it looked beautiful so I decided to give it a chance. I'm so happy I did. Short and sweet. STUNNING graphics, hilarious dialogue, quirky characters, unique combat system, immersive atmosphere and interesting storyline. I loved it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056359075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1608246561}
review:
I loved this game for the unique "combat" system and it's hilarious dialogue and beautifully crafted world. The zones are unique yet themed to match their world perfectly. It was a pleasure to explore every nook to find items and ask for a rematch to improve your score. The art and music are great and overall the controls were easy to learn.

I fell in love with the protagonist as she is witty and full of nerd culture. I especially love the Legend of Zelda-esque outfits. Honestly this game just left me wanting more with how short it was, probably my only complaint!

author: {'steamid': '76561198084464400', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1471013742}
review:
PROS:
- 2 different endings...
- beautiful graphics
- awesome soundtrack
- many secrets
- nice exploration game
- a few quests
- loveable characters
- easy 100% achievements

CONS:
- ...they're allmost the same
- too easy spirit fights, even on hardest difficulty

RESULT:
I can highly recommend this game, if you like exploration games. There are some battles, but those are only a reaction test, nothing really special or challenging, even on the highest difficulty. The music, atmopshere and graphics are really outstanding and comes with a few of different settings for the player to explore. Every character in game is different and loveable. For achievement hunters it's also interresting, that all of the achievements are easy to get. Only a few achievements need some grinding. Another cool thing is, that there a two different endings, but those are only a bit various from each other. The storyline is nothing special, but the one or other suprise you might experience anyway. For me personal even the 10$ are not too high priced. After all I got 9 hours of gametime, so only 1 hour too less for best time/price performance. :) (\√¥/)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026124098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1471628571}
review: This game was a fun one to play. You have to pick flowers to trade for items to help with your picking of more flowers. The evil mayor is trying to oppress the wooden folk in the village. And being the hero that you are as a teacher, you most definately want to pick the flowers on the back of your oppressors... All you have to do is chase them, jump on them back and pick away! Beware of the bombs... loads of custom clothes, hats and pets to find and unlock. Short, simple, and a hell of alot of fun!! Who thought picking flowers was so much fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141804718', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1469834796}
review:
.
 There  is nothing  bad  about  Lili  and it  was ok . It has great  visuals and  the sound and music is ok. The writing for the characters  was very good  and this is where the game shines .  This game is a very short  . This is what you do in the game  talk to  constructs  those  are the ones oppressed by the  sperits. 

Chase the spirits  ( the oppressors ) and pick flowers off there back .  kick pots full of money and open treasure chest with various items in them .   It is a very easy game to complete. But it is a very short game .  If you read the description this was originally  a game played on   smart phones,   Given my play through of   it do I recommend you buy it ?  


I would purchase it but at a reduced price .. There is not what I would call full voice acting . Each character has  a sound loop  with various sounds. Given for various printed   answers .But with limited  sounds  and face expression .   Lili  in my opinion does not have a lot of replay value . I would  say playing this game is like watching a very good old Walt Disney cartoon   movie. That you had not seen before. .  but once you see it the first time  you really do not want to be watching it over and over again. 

Also fair warning I did not have any  problems with this game . But  it seems others have  and according to this  LiLi community thread the developers have  abandoned the game years ago .  
 


http://steamcommunity.com/app/266490/discussions/0/351660338694245476/

as with all games look at  lets plays on you tube etc  to form your own opinion  and my recommendation for LiLi is that you  buy it at a reduced price.  Given what it was I think about $3 should be what  should be charged for this game .

author: {'steamid': '76561198070003091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1448686998}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is a very short but amazingly fun game. The characters are pretty original, and the gameplay style is something on it's own. The actual story should only take about 2-3 hours, but it's amazingly fun plus there are achievements to hunt for.

The story is basically you're a botanist girl going to a strange island to learn about the flowers. While there, you meet these wooden NPCs called Constructs that you befriend. You find out they're enslaved by the spirits, and so you go on a quest to defeat the spirits and free the constructs.

The gameplay is mostly simple. It's just find the items or jump on a spirit's back and take their flowers to win. The key element that makes the game enjoyable is how beautiful and crisp all the design is. Everything is in an almost super-HD style and it is really pretty.

I don't know if I'd play it for the full 10 dollars, but on sale I got it for 3 and it was worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023449883', 'num_games_owned': 1676, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1468739433}
review:
This game is incredibly darker than the games description on the steam store lets on. Assault, kidnapping, attempted murder, cannibalism. Yes, cannibalism. 
Enemies beg you to stop, pleading to not be violently deflowered. That's right. You violently deflower your enemies from behind. Chasing them down, or sneaking up on them from their blind spots. When you're close enough you'll [b]leap upon them and begin your assault[/b]. They'll beg, plead, cry out in pain, even struggle and lash out to shake free from your grasp. And you'll set an actual flashbang off in their face to pacify them while tightening your grasp on your victim. If you do well enough you'll also collect a trophy in the form of their mask they wear, available for you to wear. Showing your next victim they aren't the first and likely won't be the last. When The Mayor stations guards to stop you, a merchant sells you information on where they'll be. This allows you to get the drop on your next victim blocks away from those ordered to protect the people you're assaulting.
One of your victims worries their spouse will leave them after you've violently deflowered them. Young, old, male, female. The main character does not discriminate. Eventually assaults the Mayor in the same way, claiming him as yet another notch in the main character's belt. This is some seriously messed up, rapey stuff. And all of this is in the game, including dialog.
A game Bill Cosby and Bill Clinton would approve of. 
At the end of the game main character's father mentions the main character's deceased sibling. At no point in the game are we introduced to this information before then. The fact that the it comes up so very late in the plot can only mean the main character murdered their own sister. The main character is a psychopath, maybe even a drug dealer.

Would play again.

Total time played: 9.3 hours.
Price: 10 USD

author: {'steamid': '76561198090847199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1468391789}
review:
corto no, lo siguiente.
pero uno de esos juegos que tienes que jugar si tienes ganas de algo tranquilo y bonito en donde nadie ni nada te apura y puedes pasearte por ahi admirando los esenarios y la bellesa del estilo artistico que guarda este juego.

perfecto para desestresarse un rato despues de andar con la vena hinchada en otros juegos por esa quinta partida perdida consecutiba o ese boss imposible que no puedes matar.

no supone ningun reto, es solo admirar el juego en si y dejarte enamorar por la paz que transmite. 8/10

lo unico malo es que con 3 horas ya ves todo lo que la historia tiene para ofrecer y yo creo que con unas 5 hs llegas a hacer un 100% sin problemas

author: {'steamid': '76561198042114467', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1468308628}
review:
This is a game with a really interesting premise and really nice visuals. It's colorful and interesting and to be honest, that's the part that pulled me in. Actually playing it though was something else.

It's a game that focuses more on the story which is fantastic because this is what I'm here for, I bought it on sale from summer sale, because it looked pretty and seemed interesting at least from the story aspect, but it's one of those stories that kinda throws it at you like a brick through the window. Here's Lili, your main character. What's she doing on Geos? Looking for flowers. How'd she get here? Shrug. Why is she not surprised by these talking constructs that are literally made out of wood that she did not expect to find? Seen stranger, I guess. 

All your motivitation for this game is: I told you to. The enemies are jerks, and they're mean so go beat them up for us so that they can be less jerks and we the little people can stop being bullied around. But what about the enemies (the sprites), like, why do they do anything? Idk, they're just... jerks. They go out of their way to show you how big jerks they are by pushing your construct buddies to the ground and laughing evilly, but why are they evil, and why do you care? Because flowers. So let's just goddamn, body tackle them from behind and yank out their backhairs until you yank the /special/ backhair. For science (Literally).

It feels like a kid's game, and it is, because it's a simple concept, it's bright and colorful, it doesn't punish you, but it feels TOO kid's game. A stealth game where I don't really need to sneak if I can just chase them into a corner and yank their backhairs I mean hell they turn around for me. 

I'll be fair I didn't play too much of the game, but I really didn't feel like going forward. I didn't care about the story to get over the slippery controls (I mean it, it's slippery. I kept wrestling with the camera because it kept feeling like going more to the left than what I asked it to.) The keybinds are for keyboard, but when you're doing the combat (yanking backhairs) bit, it suddenly swapped to controller which blindsided me the first time. It feels like a game with a lot of potential, but it also feels very unfinished. It feels like there should be voice acting, it feels like the sounds are stock, (Lili has the world's loudest clunky footstep sounds), the story seems so strangely fragmented that the text seems translated from another language. 

I didn't really like it, no. But hey, other people seem to be into it so what do I know.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077907555', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1468169870}
review: The game is very reminiscent of Zelda, but unlike Oceanhorn which made me feel like it was a pale comparison of a better game, Lili and Geos felt like they had a life of their own. The game is charming and while there was one crash and a couple glitches, it's definitely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207445511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1468070613}
review:
This game didn't even load, even though my computer easily met the requirements listed. I tried the various fixes listed in the forums, and none of them worked.
It was an entirely worthless experience, so much so that I bought it on sale and asked for my $2 back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990989311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1468007451}
review:
Steam really needs an  middle ground  button ...  i cant really recommend, but its not that bad either. (for a $ or 2)

I hate giving it a thumbs down  as   Its a fun lil game for younger gamers (or those just wanting to chill) ,  but just giving a warning for people expecting  more  (due to all the positive reviews)

In a way it  reminds me of a TellTale game.. where you're playing more for the story then the game....
  
IF this game had voice acting it would be 1000x better.   (might have recommended , even at a bit higher price)

Its a short game (which actuallly is probably for the best) .   It looks pretty good,  and the the writing pretty good (voices would have sold it though).  

The actual gameplay is pretty weak.   find a few items (that are laid out in front of you).  trade those items for some help/cheats  items.    'fights' are repetative.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986938859', 'num_games_owned': 1870, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1467912310}
review:
It's repetitive, the "combat" is a joke, every quest involved grinding... And yet, I played it through in one sessions. I was mezmerized by it's beauty and simplicity. And with about 3 hours of Gameplay, it's just the right lenght before it gets too tedious.

For 0,99‚Ç¨ this game was a steal! Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198090450195', 'num_games_owned': 1168, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1468192032}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is an action adventure game in the vein of Legend of Zelda.

You play as Lili, a botany university student desperatly trying to impress her strict professor. You arrive at a far away island occupied by "demons" (think spirited away) that have rare flowers sprouting from their backs.

The core mechanics revolve around jumping on their backs and retrieving said flowers.

The game has personality abound and the story is interesting with plenty  of quirky characters and dialogue.

This type of game is excedingly rare on PC which skews towards hardcore so if you have even a middling interest in the genre, Lili is worth the $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033889305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1467767805}
review:
I haven't gotten very far into the game, and though it is charming, it makes me very motion sick.

So, if you are like me and get motion sick from certain kinds of video games, you might want to steer clear of this one.

It's a shame, because it honestly looks like it would be fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181869895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1468062404}
review:
I really enjoyed playing this game. It is quite casual, easy  and short,  the achievements are easy to get too. The game has some good sense of humor and I ended up falling in love with the type of personalities in the game, almost too cute, Basically you run around, jump on enemies and pick out their flowers using different buttons quickly. 

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003316958', 'num_games_owned': 1868, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1467535307}
review:
So I've had my eye on this game for a long time but never got around to buying/playing it since I have almost 600 games. I watched it's Kickstarter since its conception as a tablet/smart phone game. The one thing I really liked about this game was the art style, this was the one thing that drew me to it. I absolutely love the way it looks. And now I'm going to throw in my two cents about this title.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
+Game is absolutely gorgeous, great art style, nice textures, some decent graphics, nice use of shaders and shadows especially.

+The worlds are very nicely detailed but not too detailed to keep with its somewhat cartoony/realistic style.

+Characters are all really nicely detailed, matches the style perfectly.

+Writing is very well done, some nice jokes that don't go over your head and just nicely done in general and each character has their own style of dialog. There are a ton of hidden adult jokes in the game, it feels almost like there was a conflict between writers, one was trying to put in all these clever little dirty jokes while the other wanted to keep it clean. And I love it, the jokes and gags are well done and not too silly or too adult. Example: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=717972689

+Xbox 360 controller support with two control options, MMO and FPS with keybinding.

+Kid friendly for the most part but it's done in a way that it's friendly and interesting for everyone, even adults.

+QTE's are fun when they work properly.

+This game has hats that are not micro-transactions. You actually...dare I say it...UNLOCK THEM BY PLAYING.

+Pets that do absolutely nothing but look cool.

+Costumes.

+Really well done music, has a Wind Waker vibe.

+Get to explore the island after completing the game.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
-Very basic game, there's really no depth to this game at all and the gameplay consists of running around, talking to people, doing some very limited side quests and then doing a QTE mini-game to defeat spirits.

-Controls are a bit confusing when using a gamepad, I personally use an Xbox 360 controller on 3rd person action games and racing games if I'm able to. Lili has some very confusing ideals for the controller. There is no pressure sensitivity for walking/running. I managed to get her to walk once by slightly pressing the stick to the side but that was it, only once. Controls for items on the UI are still showing keyboard inputs and NOT the X360 buttons. Double tapping A will make her run infinitely which is annoying when trying to click on something. Game auto locks onto items and people, I've had this happen to me a few times when trying to attack spirits and all of a sudden talk to a villager even though the cursor was showing on the spirit and NOT the villager. Also, for some reason while running, if you hold the camera left or right, your character then stays stuck running in the direction you were holding when the camera was first being turned, it's not a big deal but it makes the game feel a little clunky.

-QTE mini-game messes up, like a lot. I had the camera go into other characters, buildings and walls constantly during the mini-game. Sometimes the camera would look ABOVE the spirit and my character so I couldn't see anything at all. The QTE controls also mess up. You can press a button too early even though you saw it pop up and sometimes the buttons change around for no reason and a lot of the time the buttons won't show up or show on items you can't do anything with, like all four buttons will be highlighting the sharp weeds on the spirit's back and you have to just wait as a bomb is about to explode. I've had bombs explode because of this issue but I only ever had to retry the spirit fights twice, ever as the QTE's aren't hard, the hardest part is the bugs. I also never used an item during any of the spirit fights. And sometimes during a spirit fight, you'll pluck a flower and it will also trigger pulling a sharp weed as well, it can be very annoying at times.

-+Performance issues. The game runs fantastically for me and it looks great 99% of the time, but sometimes it'll just drop to 30-40FPS out of nowhere at the most random times, this happens in a lot of games, but there is literally no reason that a game this small in scale should tax a R9 270 2GB at 1080p, specially when there's no AA going on. This game also lacks a lot of video options, it has no advanced video options and no audio options. So a warning to those with lower specs.

-Costumes. This is my biggest gripe in whole with this game, it totes itself as having costumes but every single one aside from the secret costume at the end is just a re-colored version of her original outfit. The secret outfit is nice at first, but then you really get a look at it and it's very poorly put together, there are a lot of sharp angles, her legs are messed up and it's honestly just not that appealing. I really wish there was a costume pack or something with genuinely nice costumes.

-Bugged hat. I collected everything on my first run through the game without using any kind of walkthrough because I like to be surprised. Well, I found everything but one hat. The blue bird that you can get as a hat and a pet, I missed the hat, you get it from the cardboard axe dude, I missed it and now I cannot get it again unless I replay the game. That's annoying. I just wanted everything in a single playthrough.

-The devs try to push the game as a Legend of Zelda like title, [spoiler]they even have an outfit and pet hinting at the series[/spoiler] but it is most definitely not. It doesn't feel like a tablet title as it was born from, but it most certainly doesn't feel like a LoZ like game. And that's not a bad thing, the game is fine and isn't trying to be anything it's not but it's a bit misleading to potential buyers, especially since the art style is clearly inspired by Wind Waker minus the cell-shading.

-Game is super short, I beat it in a single sitting of only a few hours and got everything but a few achievements and a single hat that you can‚Äôt get if you missed the window to collect it.

-Music volume. It is so loud and no way to adjust in the menus, especially right in the beginning. Luckily, it's got some really nice music, sadly, there are very few songs.

[h1]Ehh's:[/h1]

-Annoyingly long achievements. Almost all the achievements for this game are just okay, I have no problems with them. But there are two I dislike; break 1000 vases and pick 1000 flowers. You'd have to beat the game a grand total of about 12 times if you were just casually smashing vases or picking up flowers and not purposely trying to get the achievement. I just don't have the patience or will power to play such a short game so many times to get two simple achievements specially since it takes a whole two seconds to break a vase when it should be instant for such a grindy achievement.

-Hats just don't fit right, they look really strange on Lili, like they're way too big and most of the hats are not very inspiring or "cool". I just feel nothing when I put a new hat on her. Masks are fine, the wings are really nice too, but the hats just do nothing for me.

[h1]Closing & Other Thoughts:[/h1]
Overall, I really dig this game. It‚Äôs not GOTY material or anything and it is a very well done port of a tablet game so don‚Äôt expect anything too crazy out of it, but it is a fun exploration game. Just know, you‚Äôre playing this game for the story, writing, art, music and characters and not the gameplay itself.

The game has some annoying issues that I addressed but ultimately, I still really liked this title and recommend it to anyone who likes exploration, story or puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993811897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1468101563}
review:
I'll start by saying that I'm surprised I played the game to the end.

Normally I'm not the adventure game type, and considering there isn't a huge amount of variety in the tasks required (nearly everything is a "find X of Y" hunt), the world as a whole is actually very well rounded and detailed both graphically and with optional flavor text and dialog. The characters are well personified with minimal (absolutely minimal) but well done voice acting.

It is also short, and I manged to beat it in ~3 hours. There is a choice to be made at a pivotal point in the story so I might actually go back and try to take another path. Plus there might be some things that subtly change the ending dialogs. I almost certainly missed some side quests/characterization too. For a relatively short game they managed to pack in quite a bit of content.

The story is simple but serves the purpose well, as does the crude level-up stats system. This is not an RPG to the extent that you need to consider min-maxing the few stats you have, and they seem to have minimal impact on gameplay. There are no dialog trees, but the dialog is at least partially context aware: If you encounter a character before you were meant to, often that encounter will be acknowledged during the dialog with other characters (eg: "Oh, I met (character) earlier...") which adds a nice bit of immersion.

The flower picking mechanic (flowers basically being used as a form of currency) is a bit tedious, and picking enough to get all of the extra items (keys, mostly) to unlock all of the optional doors and collect trinkets/flavor text is a daunting task. There is an achievement for picking 1000 flowers and boy howdy do I believe that could happen...

There's also an achievement for breaking 1000 pots - you basically walk into people's houses and break their pots for money Legend-of-Zelda style. That number seems to be a lie, though; The achievement counter advanced by 5 for every 2-3 pots broken, so I suspect the *real* number is 500. Still a lot though.

There is no health/death mechanic, and the consequence for failure is being teleported a small distance away.

The semi-optional mini game where you cling to the back of the "enemies" and pick flowers out of their heads is fun at first but gets annoyingly difficult. It is only required a handful of times, fortunately, and the reward for completing extras is merely extra masks that your character can wear.

The map consists of six areas - one of which is a single room you only deal with for an optional side quest - four of which are 99% of the game. These areas are fairly good sized, richly detailed, beautifully rendered but labyrinthine townscapes in which you meet the characters, collect the trinkets and find the switches which are the meat of the gameplay. The design and styling gives each area a very organic and "lived in" feel despite the cartoonish colors and proportions. It won't dazzle you with blooms and particle effects but it is very pretty. The mechanic by which you move from one "quarter" to the next is *nearly* seamless, with just a slight hiccup as you transition through an airlock-esque connecting area.

There is an abundance of invisible walls which gets a little annoying at times.

The protagonist character, which you play as, is notably not an annoying brat, moody or woefully inept. That wouldn't normally be something to mention... maybe I just have far to cynical a view of modern adventure games.

Finally, there is no foul language, sexually suggestive themes/dialog (not even a passing euphemism!) or meaningful violence - all "fighting" is the previously mentioned minigame where you sneak up on enemies and pluck flowers out of their head.

Overall a great game and I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025433589', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1467556913}
review: Lili is a well animated and very good looking indie game. Gameplay is very casual and relaxing, some bugs but nothing game breaking. The controls  are a bit floaty but there is no need for precise controls so i guess it is fine. Overall a pretty solid, nice and short game if you want to pick some flowers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064847986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1467496005}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is a short, but fun RPG with a nice story. It takes place on a island called Geos. On this island you have to collect flowers to complete your studies. This game has content for 3 to 4 hours. However, if you want to get all the achievements you will be busy for a little bit longer. I don't think the achievements are worth the time, but if you have some time over why not try it. 

There were some problems that I encountered. Sometimes the controls with the mouse were not as optimal as I hoped they would have been. I saw that this used to be a mobile game, so perhaps it might have something to do with that. There was also some lag between the different doors, but that did not hinder the gameplay. I did however wondered what the function of the outfits were?

Overall, a very nice short game. I would not buy it at full price, but when it is at sale it is definitely something to look at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057192014', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1467475977}
review:
A neat game, easy on the eyes, and simple.
I finished the whole game in roughly 4 hours, beating all spirits, meeting all friends, and collecting all items.
I will say that some of the achievements make so sense in proportion to the length of this game...break 1000 pots and pick 1000 flowers? No thanks.

Some of the spirits can get a little annoying as they're shaking around so much, I can't even see which buttons to press for the flowers / bombs. But I managed on. 

Overall, for .99 you can't go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001865629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1467334780}
review:
I was skeptical of this game at first but considering I got it for cheap on the Steam sale, I decided to just dive in. I almost didn't continue playing it after terms like "Speed Sandwhich" popped up, but when I gave it a chance it really hooked me.

It's an adorable little game, with fantastic art. I really enjoyed the vibrant environments, the cheeky characters, and the story was fun and funny! It was a short game, but I enjoyed playing it. 

There's no real challenge and it's not really an RPG, but it's a fun casual sort of adventure that you could relax with in an afternoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025779198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1467387843}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos es un juego de aventuras en el que encarnamos a Lili, una chica que llega a Geos con el objetivo de completar un trabajo escolar sobre las particulares flores de la zona.

Pros:
- Visualmente llamativo.
- Sistema de combate simple pero innovador.

Contras:
- Con bugs muy graves, que provocan un pantallazo negro y tener que reiniciar el ordenador. En mi caso siempre que cerr√© el juego y alguna vez al arrancarlo.
- La dificultad es baja y no es demasiado largo.
- Integramente en ingl√©s.

Conclusi√≥n: Lili: Child of Geos es un buen juego de aventuras con un sistema de combate diferente y √∫nico. Ser√≠a perfectamente recomendable para todos los amantes del g√©nero si no fuera por sus bugs. Un juego que bloquea tu ordenador cada vez que lo cierras no puede salir al mercado en ese estado y mucho menos, llevar a√±os a la venta y que los creadores no se dignen a arreglarlo.

Puntuaci√≥n: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198133573405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1508161312}
review: Lili is simple, fun, and I think it has a lot of replay value. The plot is staightforward and perhaps overly cutesy in places, but the gameplay is enjoyable and it's a good game to play when you don't want anything complicated or especially impactful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139929755', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1501743494}
review: Well, I love this game. You get three stats to work with (and can max two of them or try to level them all out) to help bring freedom to the constructs (Lili's friends that were made to be servants). Overthrowing the spirits to help the constructs live the lives they want isn't like like taking on any Dark Souls boss, so it's prefect for people who don't like combat. Lili goes around and collects flowers for an assginment, but the flowers serve more of a purpose than that. Definitely a causal game, it's fun to go around and collect the various items layed out, and the characters in game feel like family after a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136853526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1467385081}
review:
First of all I'm going to start off by saying i love this game, be it short it was still very entertaning. 
Great visuals, likeable protagonist and overall a nice game play experience which kept me wanting to play till the end (which i did) the very first time i opened it when I just wanted to see what the game play was like for myself.
Enjoyed all the refrences that you come across in game and was joyous to be able to wear a tunic such as Links, would love to see more of this series explanded upon Lili's choice for adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064808087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1513297329}
review:
"Lili is a quirky adventure RPG hybrid with stunning visuals, silky-smooth graphics, a cinematic story-line, and a fresh new way to deal with enemies." -Bitmonster Inc.

As the statement above says, Lili is truly a quirky adventure RPG. I would compare it's likeness to that of Legend of Zelda for it's adventure genre. Plus, there's some achievements that reference Legend of Zelda.

Pros:
-Stunning Visuals
-Crisp Clean Atomosphere
-Easy listening
-Easy Reading
-Bright Bold colors
-Story Rich
-Quirky but fun gameplay
-Easy Controls
-Easy Button Mapping with Controller Support

Cons:
-Awkward Buttons at First
-Combat is a Bit Odd at First
-Nothing much

I would whole heartedly recommend this game to anyone who loves RPG Adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085533113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1697319433}
review: I love this game. You get three stats to work with (and can max two of them or try to level them all out) to help bring freedom to the constructs (Lili's friends that were made to be servants). Overthrowing the spirits to help the constructs live the lives they want isn't like like taking on any Dark Souls boss, so it's prefect for people who don't like combat. Lili goes around and collects flowers for an assginment, but the flowers serve more of a purpose than that. Definitely a causal game, it's fun to go around and collect the various items layed out, and the characters in game feel like family after a while (except for most of the spirits, they really are sassy jerks). 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972822414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1466968985}
review: I rather liked this game. It looks really great and it is a bright, jolly, casual experience. It is fairly straightforward, you collect flowers, smash vases, open treasure chests and defeat evil spirits by plucking flowers from them. The characters are cute and charming with amusing dialogue. It is fairly short but well worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999355453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1467031337}
review:
Relaxing resource-gathering walking simulator with a short plot. Roughly 3-4 hours of gameplay, know what you're getting into before you buy

[b]PROS[/b]
- Beautiful graphics
- Decent camera work
- Relaxing and fun to play and explore
- Dialogue 
- Easy, even on Hard difficulty
- Relatively simple to 100% (if you're into that like me)

[b]CONS[/b]
- Repetitive and grindy
- Very short
- Easy, even on Hard difficulty

[b]7/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197979827636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1466885374}
review:
Ein wundersch√∂nes Spiel, welches leider durch Fehler/Bugs nicht wirklich spielbar ist. 
Ich z.B. kann bestimmte Quests nicht erledigen, weil get√§tigte Aktionen von mir nicht registriert werden.

Als Beispiel: 
‚Ä¢ Ich soll 3 Fotos an bestimmten Orten machen.
‚Ä¢ Diese Aufgabe bekommt man in zwei verschiedenen St√§dten.
‚Ä¢ Beide Male habe ich zwei Fotos hintereinander gemacht und bin dann zum Questgeber hin gelaufen.
‚Ä¢¬†Beide Male wurde nur EIN Foto angenommen und registriert.
‚Ä¢ In BEIDEN F√§llen kann ich das fehlende Foto nicht noch mal machen, da die Kamera an dieser Stelle nicht mehr vorhanden ist.

Letztes Update des Spiels von 2014.
Entwickler zuletzt vor 101 Tagen online.

R√ºckerstattung ist beantragt. Zwar eher l√§cherlich bei 99cent (summer sales), aber es geht mir auch mehr darum, dass Valve den dabeigeschriebenen Text liest, dass das Spiel meiner Meinung nach nicht im Store sein d√ºrfte.

Schade. Es ist so liebevoll programmiert (bis auf die Fehler). Witzige Anspielungen auf Nintendo und Zelda. Liebe Figuren. Sch√∂ne unterhaltsamme Texte/Dialoge.

Auch f√ºr erwachsene Liebhaber also etwas. Und nicht nur f√ºr Kinder.
Schade, dass die Entwickler es mit sowas kaputt machen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075611031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1491499770}
review:
Update, 4/6/2017

The game is a bit short, as you'd expect. But I had a lot of fun with it. And I'm on my way to 100% the achievements. It's at best, a game that will take you 5-7 hours to complete, if you're going for everything.

------

I like this game.

It has a nice charm to it. I'm not far into the game, but it's one of those casual RPG games where you go around collecting everything you see. On that part, it's not too overdone, and it actually makes the game even more peaceful for what it is. It's a light RPG. Best way I can put it, is - it's kind of Zelda-esque, just without any of the intense and fast paced combat.

I'll be honest here, this is one of the best games I've scored on the Steam Sale so far, at just .99c, it's hard to argue that I can possibly put many hours into this, if I want a relaxing game to go to. 

The graphics are great, and there isn't much else to it. The controls are fairly simple, the game itself is not hard to pick up. It's a perfect game to de-stress.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994894769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1465601497}
review:
Charming and beautiful, with some missteps in gameplay.

I don't remember exactly how I got this game (I think there was a Female Protagonists bundle?), so I didn't really know anything about it before it was in my library. I didn't know that it started out as a mobile/tablet game, but it makes sense considering much of the gameplay would probably be more approachable on a touchscreen.

You play as Lili, a sort of magic-botanist grad student who has traveled to an island to collect flower specimens. You navigate around a small number of interconnected maps, collecting flowers, smashing clay pots full of coins, and completing minor quests for townspeople. There is growing tension between the masked spirits of the island and their peaceful wooden servants, and your specimen hunt lands you right in the middle of the conflict.

While the exploration and character interaction is fun and engaging, the majority of the game seems to focus on one particular minigame, which is sort of a precision flower-plucking game. While clinging to the back of a masked spirit, you must accurately grab sprouting flowers while avoiding traps. The spirit bucks back and forth to create moving targets, and occasionally interrupts your progress with a "frenzy" of traps. This minigame is reasonably fun to play, although I don't think the instructions were very clear. You pick flowers while exploring by simply clicking them; to pick a flower in the minigame you have to click and pull away to uproot it. The more advanced stages get very chaotic, and it's unfortunately very easy to lose track of your cursor with all the bright objects flying across the screen.

The biggest issue I have with this minigame is that there are FIFTY separate instances for you to complete, and there's not enough variation between stages to justify more than, say, ten. Add the fact that each instance has a 3-star scoring meter, giving compulsive completionists like me cause to replay them, and it starts to get really grindy. Because of the emphasis on this particular part of the game, I assume this was the core concept that the rest of the game was built around.

Also grindy are the optional achievements for plucking flowers and smashing pots, which set the goal at 1000 (!) apiece. The flowers and the coins found in pots both function as types of currency, intended mostly for use in the item shop. The shop doesn't carry much; you can buy stat boosts, consumable items to make the plucking minigame easier, and a map upgrade (which I actually found pretty essential). There's a separate shop that sells single-use keys for locked doors. I don't quite understand why that wasn't just incorporated into the main shop, since the main shop also sells an expensive but reusable skeleton key. There's an achievement for maxing out each of your 3 stats, but for some reason they didn't make it possible to bring your 3rd stat all the way to max, so you can't 100% the game in a single playthrough.

The music is charming and pleasant, the designs and palettes are visually appealing, and there are some great particle effects. I had some trouble with the camera (mostly the FOV) when I first started the game, and it made me feel kind of queasy. It didn't help that the first area also has lots of lens flare and water spray, but once I got into town it became manageable. 

The writing was more clever than I expected, considering how cute and all-ages the game apparently is. I don't mean the plot, although there are some dark touches here and there. The character dialogue and some of the menu descriptions have a lot of character and sometimes give teeny-tiny hints of being sort of not exactly all-ages. It's often self-aware, but never self-congratulatory. As an added bonus, the main character is allowed to be female without the writing needing to rely on "girl" tropes.

There are a couple bugs (sometimes the minimap toggles off when you decide to challenge a masked spirit again) and more typos than one would expect from an updated release. When you pass through a loading gate between maps, the camera and music both stutter and it's a bit jarring.


I would love to see either a remake or sequel with more areas and a greater emphasis on exploration & collection rather than chasing & plucking. Maybe all the functionless Lore Items need to be redistributed to the correct NPCs, etc., and find more reasons to reuse existing characters and give them more involvement.

Overall it's easily worth playing. It's fun and bright and engaging, and for me, the great one-liners make up for the grinding.

Soup / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197961825286', 'num_games_owned': 1826, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1445380079}
review:
So somehow my review got lost, whether because of this "upgrade" to the complete edition, or some other reason, either way, here's my thoughts from back when I tried this abomination:

Really boring, and not my type of game.

First the options menu: It's horrible. Only a few resolution options, a few buttons for graphical options, which are preset according to setting like High, Highest, and so forth. No actual customising available. Keybindings cannot be changed. Basic mouse options of inverting, and mouse sensitivity buttons, rather than a bar or a number. All in all, the options menu needs a lot of work.

Game starts off talking to everyone, and walking into building to talk to more people. You can also add to your fun by breaking vases or opening chests. The chests contain items that have really unfunny descriptions. That is basically a recurring facet of this game. Unfunny dialogue, stale descriptions, and flat jokes.
During dialogue there is some voice work, but it doesn't match the text. Rather, it's your character saying hello multiple times in a conversation, and the constructs/spirit things making weird sounds.

Finally, the character design is pretty bad. The female doesn't have to be attractive, nor have large assets, but I'm going to have to say the haircut is pretty horrid. A tumblrina if you will. The whole look of her is unbecoming to me, other than the outfit, which is passable. I suppose she matches an explorer, although it feels like the designer wanted her to be Lara Croft, just without being attractive in a tradional sense. I suppose the word is, hipster. This is of course subjective, but will this present times inspired look work in the future, should someone find themselves playing it? Does it work in present times? I don't feel her look emphasizes 'geeky girl'. It's different, and I feel emphasizes tumblr, SJW, feminist, things of that sort. I personally don't fall into that camp, and as such, makes me worry that the game is designed by a development group that IS affected by those camps. Politics don't belong in a game, unless directly marketed as such, and creativity marred by such a thing is troubling. From what I played of the game, I don't necessarily think the game itself is an extension of SJW beliefs, but I believe the creation of the character you play as in a physical sense, IS affected by the creators political beliefs. Take that as you will.

The world is colorful, and the game is inoffensive, in terms of interactions, but it just seems aimed at a younger audience, or people with easily offended sensibilities. I like a wide range of games, whether shooters, puzzles, rpgs, or some adventure games. I'll even go back to games like legend of zelda, or super mario bros. This game, however, is not my cup of tea, and I cannot recommend it. It lacks depth, and your interactions with the world reflects that. I didn't feel engaged, and more like the game was a chore. Maybe I'll come back in the future, but as things stand, it's too boring to hold my interest.

review:
Nota: 7/10

Pros:

+Gr√°ficos bonitos y cuidados.
+Jugabilidad sencilla. Compatibilidad con el mando.
+El sonido acompa√±a bastante bien.

Contras:

-En las opciones de configuraci√≥n se nota bastante que un juego de iOS remodelado. Especialmente en la escaasa configuraci√≥n de video. Se han olvidado de decir las funciones de algunas teclas.
-El valor de rejugabilidad es escaso. Una vez has vencido a todos los esp√≠ritus no tiene sentido quedarse dando vueltas para coger las 1000 flores ni mucho menos romper las 1000 vasijas. Que haya que jugar dos veces para conseguir el logro de maximizar todos los stats tampoco tiene sentido.
-Se parece a Zelda, Broken Age o Psychonauts en lo que un huevo a una casta√±a.
-La atm√≥sfera esta bastante bien conseguida, las excesivas referencias y chistes sobre memes u otros videojuegos estorban m√°s que otra cosa.

Un juego casual y apto para todos los publicos para pasarte en un par de d√≠as. Mejor comprado de rebajas.
