author: {'steamid': '76561198048231034', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1435411016}
review: It sounds like a silly game, the gameplay is really easy and simple, no danger anytime and voice acting... But the flower picking is so much fun and I like the fantasy world design so much I actually had a lot of fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012029859', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1487508872}
review:
I only saw interest in this game for the Legend Of Zelda vibe the advertising image had, thinking it would play like one of those games. Sadly, it doesn't, but the game is riddled with nintendo easter eggs.

Lili is a short, story heavy game with beautiful graphics and simple gameplay. Controlling Lili, a teen researching this colourful island for educational purposes, you find the island is full of slave like, wooden built, sentient robot humanoids run by evil spirits (who are in the form of creepy, mask wearing creatures). The plot is simple; stop the spirits and let the robot things be free and happy. 

When it comes to gameplay, this game can get boring quickly, since there are a small amount of mechanics used to vary the gameplay up. Defeating spirits is fun at first, but after realising the amount of spirits there are to defeat in the game, I couldn't be bothered chasing them and accomplishing repeating quick time events over and over again. Sure, defeating them isn't wasted, as oyu are rewarded with their mask and character biography. Every character has a biography, which is nice, but not all characters are interesting. The main characters you meet in the story are charming, cute and even funny when reading their dialogue.

Overall, this game is colourful, happy and relaxing. Don't let the advertising image fool you, as this is far from a LoZ game. Buy this if you want a short, cheery story with a few giggles here and there, or really like to collect stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031560882', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1456524872}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068328416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1457926519}
review:
Truly impressive!

This short but quite addictive game has good mechanics, good graphics, and actually an impressive story for a casual adventure game.

I would recomend this to many gamer parents that want to introduce their kids to gaming, it's very easy to play, has good life lessons within the story, and it plays with a controller just fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119798871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1710713873}
review:
This is probably one of my favorite games in my entire library~!!
The plot is crystal clear, the characters are loveable, sceneries and the art styles are visually breathtaking, there is a vast map to explore, the music is outstanding, the enemies weren't impossible to defeat, and there is so much to do~!
Even after finishing the game, I find myself still fully immersed in the game.
It feels like a world I can just escape to and it makes me feel so relaxed and happy.
I thought the story was beautiful and even the little hidden story was a sad, but still sweet concept in the game.
I rate this 1000000+/10, best game ever~!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994799155', 'num_games_owned': 1534, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1438334250}
review:
There's something about the beautiful character designs, bright and colourful environment, simple yet challenging gameplay, and yes even the collectathon-ing that really makes this game special. The controls are a little clunky and the world feels a little 'UDK template'-ish, but there's a soul to this game that I rarely, rarely see.

You get a nice little selection of alternate costumes (mostly colour-swaps), a large selection of hats, and a few companion animals that float along-side you - all aesthetic goodies that serve no purpose, and that's how I'd want it. The dialogue in this game is solidly written, with some memorable characters; one in particular is a veritable stream of game references, which you will also find in hat collection. Will you be donning a plumber's hat, or perhaps a green hood with matching tunic and fairy? It's a little on the nose and slightly out of place, but all in good fun.

The game isn't 'huge'. You get four small areas of the island to explore, filled to the brim with unique characters and flower-picking 'combat'. You'll spend a few hours here, deep in the game's universe of wood-sprites and mask-wearing opressors. The only complaint I have about this game is its acheivements. Get ready for the long-haul, because the number of pots to break and flowers to pick requires 3-4 playthrough-lengths of grinding spawn points over and over.

In short, I can't recommend this game enough. It's the right balance of simple, fun gameplay, exploration, story, creative design and genuine heart you can't deny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048927789', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1449157475}
review:
Not sure how to feel about this game.

I've realised it's certainly difficult to pick up if you've left it for a while, and the game itself is rather clunky throughout. Lili herself is somewhat charming though, and the concept of the game is pretty interesting. The issue I find is that my laptop can handle most games, but even on the lowest resolution, Lili seems to stutter and stumble. Maybe if you have a good gaming computer this could be for you? But I'm not sure personally. I'll keep playing if my patience holds out.

Overall? Eh... it's alright.

review:
I had never heard of this game before but bought it as soon as i stumbled upon it since i thought it looked interesting. I'm glad i did.

Is the game perfect? No, but i found it to be enjoyable.

Short pro and con summary of the game.

[b] Pros [/b]

-Pretty graphics (lighting and such)

-Beautiful game world

-Very relaxing

-Some funny dialogue 

-Hats!

[b] Cons [/b]

-Will not appeal to everyone

Yes, that's the only con i can come up with.

[b] Pro and con [/b]

-Short, might put some people of, but the length of the game is fitting

[b] Final verdict [/b]

A nice change of pace and nice looks, but don't expect to much depth or longevity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043540916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1451413892}
review:
I love this game SO MUCH! 

The visuals are stunning to say the least, the battle system is very unusual, creative, and turned out to be quite a lot of fun (you literally "deflower" more-or-less-evil spirits, without actually killing them). Some dialogues and information sheets about the spirits are totally hilarious! 
And some constructs look sooooo adorable! I can definitely recommend this game for children! And adults, of course. ;) 
The overall game seems really sweet and wonderful so far.
The story is not that special so far, but it is fitting and I am looking forward to seeing how this  turns out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078370686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1450714332}
review:
I don't really remember when I bought this game but I've been sick the last few days and been trying to find something to kill time so I installed it. Not gonna lie, was not expecting much when Lili's character model loaded on the beach and then walking towards walls pushed me forward. However, I got something that was really fantastic. I really miss this genre of games that were popular in the N64 era, and don't understand why they died out. 

Basically, you're going around collecting flowers off the heads of "Spirits" which are tyrants of wood people called Contructs in order to further your studies as a ...flowerologist? (they made up some name for it don't remember anymore.) 

Anyways, if you miss these open world collecting games you'll love this. It could do with a lot of fine tuning, especially with Lili. She doesn't have any idle animation except for her fingers twitching and her clothes/hair are constantly being wind blown even inside buildings. Sometimes they zoom in on her face and she's totally expressionless in the few cutscenes they have and I feel like there's more that could be done with it. Also, I don't like how she halts when she picks up flowers from the ground or breaks pots. Kills the flow and makes collecting even more tedious. 

Upside, the writing is well done and a lot of the characters are extremely likeable and goofy. I actually had a good laugh at a couple of the Spirits and I don't often when I'm playing games by myself. Constructs can be kind of adorable too but many of them sit around crying about being slaves like it's even that hard on them. You got ping pong, guys. Lighten' up.

They don't hide the games influences (Legend of Zelda, Mario, Fruit Ninja are all referenced heavy handedly) so if you enjoy those games you'll have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116089459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1406479651}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019151045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1420223001}
review:
First seeing this game I wasn't really expecting all that much from this one but right away I was blown away. The best word to really describe this game is 'simple'. The game has a simple story, simple game play with a mix of simple RPG elements. Again 'simple' is the one word to really describe this game but the one thing that really makes this game great is how it looks. My god, if I could hop into this game world with some sort of VR headset I'm not sure if I would want to leave it's that nice. Rich colors makes things pop out on screen and the great character designs really add to the game's world.

I tried this game out of luck and fell in love with and who knows, maybe it will do the same for you.

review:
Pretty good Final Fantasy Flower Picking Sim...the enviroments are gorgeous and probably the main highlight of the game. The dialouge and stuff made me laugh, overall a pretty good game. 

Dont buy this expecting a traditional RPG battle system, the battles are you picking flowers off monsters backs by pushing the corresponding button(OR using the mouse to pull but I didnt like), some of them are pretty fast paced and challenging, some much easier.

 It has flashbangs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051527950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1437087963}
review: Such a precious little gem. It's rather blatantly inspired by the Legend of Zelda (I mean, it even hints to it a few times during gameplay with costumes and jokes and such), but still holds its own. The title character, Lili, is incredibly spunky and all of her wooden friends are hilariously sassy. It's relaxing and gorgeous to look at.... not perfect, by any means, but for a game that originated in the mobile realm and entered in the big leagues, it's a worthy title to pick up with a good sale price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995985473', 'num_games_owned': 2642, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1407505867}
review:
Add this one to the list of games I really want to like, but are ruined by a singular crippling flaw. The art, music, novel gameplay mechanics... [i]Lili: Child of Geos[/i] excels wonderfully in all these qualities, but the atrociously amateur writing ruins what would be an otherwise charming little game.

Worth playing if you can somehow overlook it, but for me? No thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065535205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1448116354}
review:
I finished the game in less than 7 hours. It is an RPG style game with beautiful graphics. The main character Lili is sent to an island to collect flowers. There are two types of habitants on the island - spirits who carry flowers and constructs who serves spirits. Lili then joins the movement to topple the powerful spirit-led government and free the constructs.

The battle mechanics is simple, click and drag flowers off the spirit's back. It is a nice and child-friendly way to present an RPG, while it isn't too boring for older people. For me, the RPG adventure and graphics is the selling point of this game.

Unless you are obsessed with getting 100% achievement, replayability is low. According to the $1/hour rule, this game is a recommend at around $6.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029034048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1447070953}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is a very short indie action adventure game featuring a schoolgirl Lili and her whimsical adventures on a strange land called Geos.

This was originally released as an iOS game and it shows. The game can be completed within about 3 hours. It isn't a very complicated game and is extremely kid-friendly. The whole game tasks you to explore around the land while doing simple subquests for its inhabitants.

There are some hostile enemies called "Spirits" that you will encounter, but because this game is kid-friendly, you don't actually engage in combat per se. The way to defeat these Spirits is to pluck flowers from them. Yes it sounds kindda silly, but then again, this is a cute little silly game in a way.

The graphics looks gorgeous despite it being an iOS game and the artstyle looks somewhat like Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker although the bloom effect is used abit too much. Soundtrack is appropriately cute with little jingles and the animations are pretty well done. 

The over-arching story while simple and humorous can be unexpectedly dark for an older audience with its underlying story of slavery and freedom. Younger children will however probably be too distracted by the action to focus on the story.

The game also features lots of in-jokes and item collections that pays homage to classic games. (Eg: Super Mario, Legend of Zelda, Portal 2 etc.) It can be quite addictive to try to collect everything and the game allows you to continue to play even if you have completed the main story.

Overall Rating: 7 / 10
A very short family friendly game that is surprisingly quite entertaining. While the game is probably targeted at children, there are some interesting treat for older audiences. Still, with gameplay at a very short 3 hours, i'd recommend only to buy when on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052025882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1446688709}
review:
Charming non-combat-driven adventure. The primary mechanic is plucking flowers from the backs of enemies, which is a fun minigame, plus there are a bunch of fetch quests, stats upgrades and outfits/hats for customising your avatar.

There are some niggles with the camera, and some items are fiddly to interact with, but I enjoyed it nonetheless. The world is compact but lush and vibrant with plenty of witty dialogue, and a satisfying character arc for Lili. Good, light-hearted, simplistic fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064125539', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1445158304}
review: Adorable and relatively short adventure game with easy gameplay. You play as the girl Lili who visits the island of Geos to find flowers she needs for a school report. The world  is not very big and it's divided into four areas that unlock as you complete quests. Most of the game is collecting flowers, breaking vases to pick up coins and entering people's houses to find lore items. There is no combat, instead you engage in mini games in which you defeat enemies by plucking flowers off of their backs. (In other words, there's no violence, but there's some vandalism and tresspassing. :D) There are a bunch of NPCs you can talk to, but the game doesn't have voice acting so expect to do some reading. It's worth it, though; although it can easily be categorized as a casual game, it is surprisingly well written and quite funny. Pick this up if you want something relaxing to play or if you need something non-violent and fun for your kids to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022458781', 'num_games_owned': 2808, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1446311979}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40165899]Curatore in lingua italiana[/url]

Lili Child of Geos √® un divertente gioco misto avventura/azione in terza persona con elementari meccaniche di progressione del personaggio. Dopo tanti giochi ambientati in mondi tetri e da paura, con colori smorti e terrificanti, di tipo horror, √® piacevole invece averne uno con colori sgargianti e luminosi, ambientato in mondi di favola. Ma anche in questi mondi incantati non si sfugge alla logica del cattivone oppressore di anime innocenti, per cui comunque bisogna sollevarsi le maniche e darle di santa ragione; solo che la modalit√† di combattimento √® una simpatica lotta di tipo particolare, assolutamente non cruenta ed in sintonia con l'ambientazione, di cui non voglio parlare per non rovinarvi la sorpresa a scoprirlo (dico solo che ha a che fare con i cavalli...).  La protagonista √® Lili, una simpatica ragazzina alle prese con un bizzarro esame per diventare una maga o qualcosa del genere. Mi √® piaciuto anche la presenza di un guardaroba di vestiario sbloccabile e/o acquistabile per Lili, insieme ad altre trovate. La pecca, secondo me, √® la mancanza di un parlato che avrebbe dato al gioco un altro spessore, sostituito da esclamazioni verbali che ogni tanto sia la protagonista che i personaggi non giocanti si lasciano scappare. In tal senso √® strano che non si sia prevista la possibilit√† di poter far scegliere all'utente in modo separato il volume dei suoni e della colonna sonora: dato che il volume di quest'ultima risulta essere alquanto pi√π elevato degli effetti di sottofondo, dopo un po' l'ho disabilitata. Un'altro difettuccio consiste nel fatto che i personaggi non giocanti, che sembrano in libera uscita dal mondo del Mago di Oz, magari potevano essere resi con uno spessore maggiore, con maggiori personalit√†. Non manca neanche l'elemento di mistero, che il gioco lascia non svelato, su cosa sia successo in passato sull'isola prima dell'arrivo di Lili e su una misteriosa passata visitatrice ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198093220384', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1443975908}
review:
Oh, Lili, where have you been all my life? It's hard to argue with anyone that might label this as a port of a casual, mobile, kid's game; you'll play as a young woman on a field trip wandering around an island, picking flowers, making friends and not really being challenged all that much. But while all that may be true, to be so reductive is to a do a great disservice to an amazing hidden gem of a game.

The most obvious strength of Lili: Child of Geos is its visuals, as there's a glowing radiance emitting from every individual pore of the world along with everything that populates it. But what's less obvious is the writing that backs it up. I feel like the dialogue in a lot of games is there merely to facilitate moving the player to the next objective or set piece, and I guess that's fair enough since actual game play is typically going to be the feature that gets top billing while the story is little more than connective tissue to form vague context for your actions. However, I think people sometimes forget gaming is an entertainment medium, and there's lots of other ways to entertain besides pure play, a fact this game thankfully does remember and arguably makes its greatest triumph.

The story is a strange mix of being playfully throw-away and surprisingly thoughtful and philosophical. Lili travels to the island of Geos in search of its unique floral life as part of a final school exam, but once there finds it is inhabited by Spirits and their workforce of slave Constructs. These large, wooden homunculi must tolerate the bullying whims of their masters lest they cease to exist upon failure to serve their purpose. I probably make it sound much heavier than it really is, but it does at least dabble with notions of free will and life choices and prioritising the things that are really important to us, which are bigger issues than most titles will ever dare to approach. As it transpires, these Spirits have the most exotic flowers, which also gives them their power over the Constructs, setting the scene for several hours of roaming Geos searching for Constructs to help and Spirits to deflower.

Geos is made up for four medium sized districts that are unlocked sequentially as you rid each one of its Spirits. The game and its world may not be huge, but that just allows them to focus on populating it with beauty as every inch of the environments are lovingly crafted with a wondrous level of detail. In many games you'll find yourself wandering into some stranger's house and find the entirety of their personal dwelling is made up of a table and a few chairs, or maybe a bunk bed and a fireplace if they're lucky, that sort of thing. I love how every single house in this game looks properly lived-in, with bedrooms, kitchens and even bathrooms, which really sells the illusion that this is a real world being inhabited by real people... or wooden slaves and freaky tree spirit things, in this case. I really wish more games would take the same effort to make the peripheries of the world just as interesting as its core like this one does.

Unfortunately, when it comes to game play, that's where I'd probably have to admit the game is at its weakest. You'll spend the majority of your time here either picking flowers, smashing vases, looting chests, talking to people or ambushing Spirits, with the amount of time you spend on each of these things pretty much depending on the type of player you are and what you decide to make your goals for this game. There's no combat as such, and you can't die, the only real challenge being trying to jump on the backs of the game's 50 Spirits and playing rodeo with them as you pluck their flowers off. Otherwise it's all a very leisurely affair, the only other complication being upgrades to help make your plucking experience a little easier.

So, yes, it's kinda short, it's arguably shallow in some areas, and it isn't massively challenging, but there really is so much warmth and charm and personality exuding from every part of this game that I feel like it more than makes up for any other shortcomings. Lili herself in particular is the very embodiment of this as she's an incredibly lovable foil to the rest of the cast and a perfect example of a well-balanced female lead that's entirely capable in her own right rather than lazy developers falling back on sexuality to sell a character. I think there's still great depths of enjoyment to be drawn from Geos, and especially from Lili herself, and I can't wait to join her again on her next adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131909409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1439492568}
review:
This game personally just wasn't my cup of tea. 

I was interested in this game because it looked cute and I thought the story would be interesting and both are true. Graphics are splendid. I loved the personality of the characters, and the story was okay. 

However, I just couldn't with that gameplay. Majority of it was basically... well... flower picking. Yes. I'm not joking. Go around this island and collect some flowers. Bring them back if you want the rest of the story. Then we'll send you back to collect more flowers. I mean, after a couple of times, you would get bored of it as well. 

I just didn't finish it because I was that bored. But that doesn't mean this is a bad game, but this game seemed too childish (not in the insulting way) in a sense. I like playing both casual and serious games, but I think my little sis would have more fun playing this than myself xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198114662499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1442657412}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is a beautiful and relaxing action adventure. When I saw screens of it I first thought this is probably some kind of highly polished hidden object game. What ‚Äúsold‚Äù me was when I discovered you can actually walk this marvellous world.

Item hint: [spoiler]Get the Skeleton Key early on as well as the Treasure Map (helps you keep track of chest and find flowers). Boots, bracelets and necklaces seem to have negligible effects when hunting Spirits.[/spoiler]

+ Beautiful somehow cuddly graphics
+ Mostly relaxing atmosphere
+ Okay story, hints to a possible prequel
+ References
+ Moderate length
+ Game advises to visit the options menu and asks to automatically determine graphics settings
+ Basically no grinding
+ Good controls
0 Unfortunately no voice acting
0 Different camera modes
- Some advertising for another BitMonster game
- Level cap, making it impossible to max out all skills with the same avatar
- Flowers sometimes in places that are simply unreachable

I started playing this game in the hope it would provide a counterpoint to Dead Island which had become exhausting and bullseye. After playing like 15 minutes I felt pretty relaxed. The game still has tense moments but all in all it's a pretty tranquil experience.
Although the game's world is not too big it has an expansive feel to it, maybe because it looks lived-in or alive.
The back story is rather light, maybe owed to the mobile origins of the game. You control Lili who has come to Geos as a Vegi-Magical student from the Gildern Magis College (with a deadline) but is quickly entangled in in the conflicts of a two-class society. Most NPCs have some depth to them which you learn by interacting with them, i.e. fighting the bad ones (Spirits) and talking to the good ones (Constructs). There is usually a reward for exhausting interaction.
There are some indicators to a story that happened before so there may be a prequel.
[spoiler]
[list]
[*]A Construct mentions a geophantasmogramist visiting the island before Lili
[*]There is a pair of glasses in the lighthouse that look like Lili's
[*]A letter from Lili's father mentions Lili's lost sister
[*]Lili finds a tombstone for a girl named Orchid, who may have been, fitting in with flower-named girls, Lili's sister
[*]The game's title is ‚ÄúChild of Geos‚Äù so Lili is supposedly linked to the island
[*]The fishes find Lili's eyes (without glasses; the player never sees them) very interesting, alternating between wanting others to see them or Lili to hide them
[*]Left over comb
[/list]
[/spoiler]
The Constructs are wood-based being making a disturbingly wood-based living in wooden houses with wooden furniture and wooden toilets, even toilet paper [spoiler]and even bringing it to a Soylent Green conclusion[/spoiler].
There are a number of pop-references in the game and there is a mock pop-quiz where Lili can show off here extensive knowledge of games.
There is also occasional, not too much, advertisement for another game by BitMonster.

The game is of moderate length and may take you two evenings to complete. You can explore the world some more after you beat it. There are a number of achievements that may make you play some more and the ‚Äúmax out skill‚Äù achievements actually require you to stature at least one additional game ‚Äì it took me not quite an hour to max out a single stat. Besides that there is almost no grinding.

Unfortunately, there is no voice-acting. Instead there are a few generic sounds or words, e.g. ‚ÄúHello‚Äù, and Lili's feelings are well-done by stances and facial expressions.

With so many games not actually having any actual options, I found it interesting that the game starts out with advising you to go to the options menu and offers to automatically determine your machine's graphic settings.

The controls work fine with the world's topology and are pretty tight with few exceptions. When chasing a Spirit it happened at times that instead of jumping onto them I suddenly found myself in conversation with a Construct or picking a flower because the game decided that was more likely what I wanted. Then you're supposed to collect flowers set around the world but a few of them are simply set in places Lili can never reach, e.g under bridges.
There is a number of different camera modes that aren't listed in the games help - I didn't find any use for them. Activated them with keys Insert, Delete, Home, End, PageUp, PageDown, then move around a bit to see their effect.

Lili: Child of Geos was a lot of fun and I recommend it. I bought the game as part of a bundle and probably wouldn't buy it for the full price (currently 10 Euros) but wait for 50% off. I'd be delighted  to see another game of this kidney, maybe a sequel or Orchid prequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154109371', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1440750188}
review: I really enjoyed this game! It was tons of fun, and I loved all the Legend of Zelda references. I thought the concept was pretty unique and the art was just beautiful. It was a really gorgeous game to play. I wanted to do every quest, and I have to admit that I was pretty sad when it was all over. I do have a few complaints, however. There were definitely some bugs with the achievements. I beat Monty five times on hard and nothing happened. I created a new file and that seemed to fix it. There are also not enough vases in that game. Trying to break 1000 of them took forever. The camera angles were also really frustrating. Sometimes I would be attacking a spirit and the camera wouldn't let me SEE the flowers no matter how many times I pressed the different arrow keys. That being said, I definitely recommend this game. It is very cute and super fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014644228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1548088776}
review: My four year old daughter wanted to play games with me and all the games I own are shooters and zombie games so I had to find something suitable for her that was easy enough for her to play by herself when she wanted to. This game was perfect to fill that role. The graphics, lighting, environments, and controls are great. My daughter has no problem making her way around picking flowers and breaking pots. I only wish the characters would actually talk rather than us having to read text. Other than that, It served its purpose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017706666', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1437418743}
review:
[h1]A Paladin‚Äôs Steam Review: Lili: Child of Geos. Picking Flowers With the Sun Flares in my Eyes.[/h1]
[list]
[*]Genre: 3rd Person Light RPG
[*]Developed & Published by: Bitmonster Inc.
[*]Platform: Windows, Mobile
[*]Business Model: Base Game
[*][i]Copy Purchased by Myself[/i]
[/list]
[b]Overall Gameplay Thoughts[/b]
Lili: Child of Geos is a 3rd person casual adventure game about picking flowers and exploring a strange, colorful and cartoony island. Said island is under the tyrannical ruler of the Mayor of the wood spirits. So, what's a girl to do? Pick flowers off of their heads until she viva la revolutions the entire island. Duh. I mean, using a sword/gun is so 2012 anyway. Well, the non-voice acted characters in this game are happy enough to greet you upon your arrival. Some have side quests and others just want to chat. The side quests are amusing (and sometimes eye-raising) but are pretty much busy work fetch quests. The exploration is reasonable but a bog standard affair of finding keys and opening locked doors/chests to locate the multitude of artifacts in the game. What‚Äôs rather interesting about the key system is that you can buy a skeleton key pretty early on and it makes a key vendor completely pointless before you even get the chance to encounter him. That wasn‚Äôt well thought out. Otherwise, this is a fairly standard and mechanically light adventure game. So, let‚Äôs talk about the flower picking. 

[b]Flower Picking Mechanics[/b] 
The main mechanic to fight the wood spirits is picking a certain amount of white flowers plus the final red flower from their heads within the time limit that Lili can hold onto the spirits. You have to sneak up to them or catch them in a run in order to start the flower-picking mini-game and this isn't very difficult to accomplish. Picking flowers is done by click and holding a flower and then dragging them away from a spirit‚Äôs weaving head as they run around. Lili must do this while avoiding accidental clicks on thorns or allowing bombs to explode. There are also green flowers that extend's her grip time and gold-coin flowers that give Lili, well, more gold. There are also ‚Äúbonus rounds‚Äù where the head may be covered with bombs, gold coin flowers or thorns. Upon completing the level, the game will rate your score, giving you one to three stars for how well you did. You can then replay each spirit to get a better score, if you wish. This is repeated for every wood spirit ‚Äúfight‚Äù and the only thing that really changes is the difficulty and amount of grip time Lili has. 

This mechanic isn‚Äôt the most interesting I‚Äôve stumbled across. It definitely feels like it was designed for touch screens first and it doesn‚Äôt make the best transition to the mouse. Its passable when using the mouse but I think you‚Äôd find it more entertaining on a tablet. The flower picking is certain different from what I normally see. However, I will say that It‚Äôs good that the campaign is as short as it is. Since it really starts to run out of steam towards the end. I can‚Äôt imagine a longer campaign sustaining itself on the back of this idea. 

While Lili claims it‚Äôs a RPG hybrid, it‚Äôs an extremely bare-boned one. The only things you can customize when you level up are your running speed, time under stealth and grip aka how long you can hold onto forest spirits. Which are certainly helpful to progress through the game, there‚Äôs not a lot of in-depth choice to any of these stats. The other things you can customize are Lili‚Äôs clothing, floating companion and hat she wears while running around the island. There‚Äôs a decent amount of selection but they only affect how Lili looks. 

[b]Story Thoughts[/b]
The story is pretty straightforward. You‚Äôre Lili, a student at some school who‚Äôs on assignment to this island to find flowers for some research project. Upon arriving to the island, she sees how the wood constructs are being oppressed by the wood spirits and their mayor. Though he‚Äôs not very good at stopping you from achieving your goals. The wooden constructs request that she helps them out. So, she does. What follows is an amusing, light-hearted exploration of the island. Littered with references, jokes and quirky characters. The script is pretty well done, especially when it comes to some of the descriptions of artifacts she‚Äôll find along the way. Though some of the character growth dialogue that Lili has feels forced or out of place. The whole subplot of Lili being unsure whether she wants to continue her degree at the college or if she wants to do something else. It just kind of comes out of left-field. 

[b]PC Settings, Audio/Video and Controls[/b]
Originally developed for mobile devices, Lili was ported to PC later on to mixed results. Lili‚Äôs settings menu is horrendous and lacking a lot of features that should be here. There‚Äôs a casual-normal-hardcore difficulty slider. Graphics can be changed but only with a quality slider low-medium-high that gives you very limited control on how the game looks. For resolutions, I could only select 1280x800 and 1680x1050 (my native resolution), with full or borderless window. Windowed mode doesn‚Äôt seem to exist. It's very inadequate for a third person title even if it does run rather well. Music can be turned on and off but there‚Äôs no slider to adjust the volume of the music or sounds. 

It does get worse with the keybindings. You can‚Äôt change them. The game simply displays a keyboard showing you what they are and that‚Äôs it. This is where Lili shows her mobile roots the worst. You can get by with what it has and the game is short enough to prevent it from being annoying. However, I'd prefer to see the devs make the settings menu more comprehensive and customizable in the future. 

Probably the biggest problem I had with Lili was the control scheme. Lili has two different input schemes: ‚ÄúFPS‚Äù and ‚ÄúMMO‚Äù. It seems that the MMO style was designed for touch screens while the FPS style was intended for regular PC gamers. The difference between the two is mainly how the camera can be changed in regards to your moment. MMO has you click and dragging to move the camera while FPS‚Äô camera stays with your mouse. Regardless of which style I picked, I was never entirely satisfied with how Lili controlled. She felt largely unwieldy to move around the island. Especially as you started getting movement speed items. It took playing around with my mouse‚Äôs DPI setting, the in-game mouse sensitivity and input scheme before I could get it to a place where I was reasonably ok with it. 

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]
I liked my short time with Lili. However, I‚Äôm having a hard time deciding whether I should recommend this to anyone else. With the main mechanic being just about picking flowers, there‚Äôs really not much to this title. Even the flower picking is only really fun at first, then it loses its appeal towards the mid-to-late end of the game. There aren‚Äôt any puzzles or platforming or any other ideas to sink your teeth into. So, it‚Äôs a bit lacking. I‚Äôm also aware that this is a more casual adventure game. As such, I‚Äôm willing to let a lot of this slide because I knew what I was getting into. Additionally, there are control and PC settings menus that are just...extremely lacking. That all said, if you‚Äôre just looking for a casual adventure experience to break things up, Lili is a title to give a look. Otherwise, I‚Äôd recommend looking somewhere else for something that has a little more depth and content. Do not expect something on the level of Legend of Zelda or a more involved RPG because it will disappoint.

[b][url=http://wp.me/p4fZDz-2no]Read the Review on A Paladin Without A Crusade[/url][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197965953724', 'num_games_owned': 1245, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1438413869}
review:
I awoke on the island of the tree-men. I faced the contempt of the masked masters of this land. My weapons? My bare hands. This flowery redemption will be mine, the tree-men will know their peace! Across the land, the masked masters will hear my footsteps and tremble, fleeing while casting explosive glances behind them in my direction. All through the... wait, what the fuck, is that a Mario hat? Haha what the heck check it out the dude's talking about "All your base are belong to us" lol that's hella funny. I can't believe that bird just pooped on me lmfao. Flower-Picking Simulator 2014!!

Pros:
- Very pretty
- Slightly absurdist, awesome writing
- Simple yet effective plot
- Gameplay is straightforward

Really the only major con is that it's a mobile port, so the "combat" aspect and RPG elements are well-defined but simple. It definitely works and is quite playable but the potential to have a bit more variety is there. Game is also pretty short, I played it in 4.4 hours in one sitting and I'm a bit of a completionist. I didn't get the 1,000s of flowers or vases achievements, but I did take my time. However, this was the perfect length for what I was looking for at the time. 

Excellent mobile port adventure 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198021738598', 'num_games_owned': 1502, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1438012882}
review:
Originally designed for iOS and ported to the PC steam, BitMonster has brought an endearing adventure game, and protagonist. You play a young college girl named Lili who arrives on the island to complete and assignment for her class. Little does Lili know that she will be on a grand adventure to save the Constructs from the evil spirits who inhabit the Geos. 

The game lacks any classical combat mechanics instead opts to use quick time puzzle events, and exploration to drive the story, and multitudes of side quests. The game is short, but does not over stay its welcome, and has more than enough depth to keep you pushing forward to complete the game and the optional side quests. 

Where the game lacks is in UI elements. The UI is often cumbersome or just archaic at times in its presentation and having to search through your pets, hats and outfits to find what you want. The other major issue that I ran into while playing the game was sometimes the controller would switch to keyboard and mouse controls and force me to switch out of the game and back in, in order to fix it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078498143', 'num_games_owned': 2152, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1509354411}
review:
Hello everybody,
lets have a look at Lili: Child of Geos.

You like brutal action with a variety of hundrets of Weapon and hundrets of different enemies?
You wan`t to see pixel blood and kill your Enemies?
All right!!!

So this game is NOT for you.
We have fast clicking action, you have one weapon (Your barely hands) and one Type of Enemies (Spirits).
You will see flowers and get them from their Head.
Sounds boring, hmm?

It is not!!!

Lili: Child of Geos is a small pearl in a sea of Sharks. It is a short but fine lets say Action Adventure with a nice graphic style and nice music. You are Lili and arrive and at to Island Geos on the search for flowers, because Lili is a Student and needs them for her exam. Fastly she found out that somethings wrong on the island and she, the only human on the 
Island, must do the things right.

The Graphics reminds me to an old game called Zanzarah (Nice game, you should google it.) and presents a wonderfull detailed world. You can control Lili via Mouse and Tastatur and have a free choice of your ways. You follow a main story but have sidequests. Your target is to solve the Islands Problems. You can earn money via collecting Flowers, finding treasure or defeating spirits. For those you have to come near them, jump on their back and in a minigame you must get the flowers from their heads. Sounds simple, should be, but can be harder as you thought.
You can also raise your skills, that helps you to get and defeat the spirits. Also you can spend the money in usefull items. 

Most of the achievements are very easy, some depends on grinding but i think the hardest one ist to defeat all the spirits in the Gold way (You can get Bronze, Silver or Gold, depends on how good you get the flowers from them). 

I like this game and i have much fun with it. Yes it is short. I`m through after about 5 hours, but i wan`t all the achievements, so i will play on. 
Thanks to Bitmonster for this little pearl. Would  be nice if you make a second part.

Thanks for Reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965282243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1437205935}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is an adventure game that reminds me of the newer Zelda games.  You go on quests, break pots to get loot, challenge enemies, unlock doors and the character talk in text not voice.  Lili is a less violent version of Zelda because you can't die and the enemies are defeated and not killed.  Instead of swinging a sword you pick flowers off their head.  It sounds like a cheezy game but I had fun playing it and it takes some effort to get through the game.  The graphics are really good and the gameplay is easy.  This game is no match for Zelda but it's a fun adventure none the less.  Great for all ages.  I would like to note that considering this game was originally a mobile app game I'm impressed how well it's made.

[b]Pros[/b]
Simple gameplay
Graphics
Clean language
Not very long (complete around 5-7 hrs).  If this was a Zelda game that would be bad but for this game it's good.

[b]Cons[/b]
Achievements - most are easy to get but there's one you can't get with one playthrough which I find annoying.  To get all 3 training achievements you have to play through a second time.  You can get 2 out of 3 in a single playthrough.  Also, the game wants you to collect 1,000 flowers and breaking pots.  The flowers one takes time but not hard if you constantly collect them.  The breaking pots one seems to take forever because there's fewer of them and never marked on your map.  By the time I finished the game I only broke around 500/1,000...ugh!  If you're serious about achievements that will take up more than 5-7 hrs to complete the game.  The achievement issue doesn't make the game bad, just annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052444935', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1436878215}
review:
So, this game. Basically, there are two possibilities: either you want all the achievements, in which case you'll play between 5 to 10 hours and have to start a second save (there is ONE achievement that cannot be finished with one save. But it'll take like half and hour MAX to get it done with the second, so...), or you just want to play the game to the end, which is maybe less than 5 hours. (all this in casual mode)

I liked playing this. I had two or three times when Lili got frozen/bugged, but they were resolved with a menu on/off in two seconds. The game is very repetitive, if you want all the achievements (get 1'000 flowers, 1'000 broken vases,...), but those will go much faster if you check the tips section on Steam's page.

The characters are interesting. It's nice not to have human characters for once, and the dialogs can be fun in a nonsensical way. For a female character, Lili isn't even written annoyingly (much) which has to be noted, since female characters make so very often me want to slam them into the wall. Guys definitively can't make female character interesting. It's like they can't imagine that they could possibly multi-faceted. 

Anyway, nice game. Not worth more than the 10 ‚Ç¨ it is sold at, but fun and beautiful, and easy enough if you only want to play the casual mode (haven't tried normal/hard though)

Ah, one thing: you can't change the keys in the option menu, and wasd in azerty keyboard is a pain. So remember to alt + shift your keyboard to an english keyboard before starting (or during the game, since I always forget myself, before launching said game ^_^;; )

author: {'steamid': '76561198032672318', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1585855252}
review:
I am sad to say this game was a disappointment to me. I bought it (like many people have) based on the dazzling screenshots and videos on the store page, and because it said it was an RPG. It took about a minute since I booted it up to realize that what I had just bought was in no way an RPG and in no way the game I had paid for. If only the Steam refund system had existed back then.

The sad part is that this game is beautiful. Really beautiful. The soundtrack isn't half bad either. Now if only those things could have been combined with a robust combat system, a world larger than 3 subdivisions in a small town and more than just a smattering of a story line then it might have been a runaway hit instead of such a letdown. Seriously, you can beat this thing in 3 hours or less, and all the side quests are nothing but fetch and find quests.

I want to like this game, but I just can't bring myself to. It would be great if someday someone made a sequel or reimagining of this game, kept the theme, kept the characters and environment, but totally rebuilt and expanded everything else. It would blow minds. This, however, just blew a hole in my wallet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125830895', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1433955743}
review:
Worth it, especially on sale. This casual game is extremely aesthetically pleasing. I will stress casual- I bought this expecting something fluffy to play and I got exactly what I wanted. The story is also not overly long as I've played through the game twice with 13 hours and I reaaaaally took my time.

There's a cute story to go with everything and references to the developers inspirations at every turn. You play as a young woman named Lili who embarks on a quest to deflower an island of spirits for her botany thesis and save wooden people from certain doom. I enjoyed that there's some darker themes to this game too- cannibalism, drugs, and murder to name a few. 

The fighting is extremely fun, you hop on top of an unsuspecting spirit and yank away at the rare flowers growing from them while avoiding being shaken off or hurt by traps. You can replay certain enemies as much as you'd like- and the bios definitely had me giggling. 

..Go pick some flowers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011909987', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1435875692}
review:
Pick flowers from their heads to beat enemies. Ha, nice idea.

Short and simple, but sweet and family friendly (but not childish) action-adventure with colorful, lovingly art design and nice The Legend of Zelda references - I mean, just look at the game profile pic on the shop page. The zeldalike music in the first of the 4 short areas made me smile all the time. Still enough own ideas, e.g. you don't have weapons in this game, see first line.

Visually improved port of a good looking mobile game (Unreal Engine 3) - see Community Hub for pretty impressive comparison shots.

First playthrough will take you about 5 hours, but I stayed longer on the island as I use to take my time if I like a game.

44 of 46 achievements can be unlocked during the first playthrough (and only 2 of them are collectibles achievements and need some extra time), the last 2 achievements need a 2nd and 3rd start - not playthrough - of the game and can be unlocked within ~25 min each.

review:
Pros:

Good  easy going game with low intensity 

Great nonviolent combat system

Smart, funny, relatable female protagonist

Fun, heart warming, and enjoyable story

Beautiful visuals and music

Priced just right

Cons: 

Game play time might be too short for some people

May not be enjoyed by people wanting violent combat

If you enjoy video game trivia you‚Äôll enjoy this game. If you enjoy dressing up like link, breaking pots, and having a fairy follow you you‚Äôll enjoy this game. If you enjoy picking flowers, wearing the mask of spirits, and exploring a world where birds poop rainbow paint you‚Äôll enjoy this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198001439705', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1435535480}
review: Between 'Shipwreck', another game available on Steam, and 'Lili: Child of Geos', I feel like I've recently had two opposite, but immensely entertaining and thought-provoking, takes on what makes a Zelda game fun. 'Lili' really shines a light on the character, dialogue, color and collection aspects... while doing away with the crappy camera work of the N64. Really recommended.

review:
Fancy, pretty, flower picking fun? 
Didn't know what to expect, but the gameplay is decently smooth. 
Lots of atmospheric feels and decent skill system..

Try it on the hardest difficulty.

I feel like such a Pansy... (that's a flower!) :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198150906571', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1435345564}
review:
It doesn't take very long to playthrough, maybe a few hours tops (unless you want to go around breaking all the vases etc), but the graphics are so beautiful, the island looks great. There are a few places where you might get stuck in the middle of path or can't reach certain things but it doesn't really affect the game too much. I think the story is original enough and the characters are quite quirky In my opinion and quite likable ^^ Among them are some (Seemingly flirtatious) fish and wooden constructs. You get to do side quests helping out the residents etc as well which makes it a lot easier when you're getting to grips with things. I wouldn't say I loved this game but it was charming in it's own way, one thing I really liked about it is that you're free to explore the Island as much as you like during or after you've finished. I would say it is more suited to younger gamers as it's quite simple and tame, also you might find that the achievements during the game are glitchy. A lot of people have had random achievements being unlocked at different times but if this doesn't bother you I'd recommend it :)

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=466277682

author: {'steamid': '76561197999643823', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1434853504}
review:
I wouldn't say this game is "like Zelda", I'd say it "*feels* like Zelda". It has a really cool world with different races of creatures, you help them out in sidequests, etc. But beyond that, there's no action, or even any real enemies. And having 3 skills that just do the thing a little better (Speed = faster walking) does not an RPG make. At least IMO.

After I stopped trying to compare this game to what I thought it was going to be, I really enjoyed it. You have to accept that most of this game is running. Go back and watch the trailers and see what happens: running & talking to NPCs. Which is indeed what you do but it's fun because of exactly those things. The world is really amazing; it looks beautiful and unique. The dialog with the NPCs has great humor and various video game (and other media) references and the music is just plain amazing, mostly because it sounded inspired by the music of Zelda games. I found myself reading the text of everything in the game (Treasures, baddies, etc) because they were often very funny and often had great references to video games and things of other media. And Lili is a pretty awesome protagonist.

I feel like this game gets a lot of flack because it's not what people expected, which is true. The way it is marketed is rather misleading so as a result, a lot of people buy it who would not have if they had seen footage of it represented properly, which means they won't enjoy it. No, it's not going to appeal to everyone, but I would argue that there is a large number of people who would find it very enjoyable. It's a very original, simple adventure game with video game references, amazing atmosphere, and great writing. And it's got hats. How can you go wrong with hats?


[And I would like to point out that -by the credits- this game was made by 5 people, which makes me respect it all the more. I hope to see more Lili in the future, maybe on a grander scale.]

author: {'steamid': '76561198052085688', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 1, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1434769245}
review: It is a very charming game, great for adults and kids as anyone can appreciate how beautiful the game looks. However, the port from iOS to Windows is absolutely terrible, making all but the most powerful machines stutter. For example 60 fps in Skyrim at 1080p is no problem for my system, but I hardly got 30 in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052299863', 'num_games_owned': 1988, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1434811596}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is a nice quirky little game for in between!
The game - originally only for mobile devices - convinces with it's pretty visuals and very own charm. Just don't expect "too much" from it for it is very short. 

Nevertheless I would recommend it, since it is a funny little game to lift your mood and very enjoyable due to its fresh and unique gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220340268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1431278757}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040846298', 'num_games_owned': 1098, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1434643789}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is a fun game if you are looking for a easy-going, slow-paced experience. There is not a lot of complexity to it so those that are looking for a challenge won't find one here. The story tries to hit some areas that I didn't expect with becoming independent and discovering what it is that Lili wants to do in life but it never becomes something that connects. 

The parts of Lili that really stick out are things such as the attention to detail as almost every room you walk into is something different. The world is also incredibly charming to run through as you hunt down spirits to pick flowers off of.

Overall: If you want an easy game withe simple mechanics this is a game for you, if not then maybe go somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090244527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1558746256}
review: First off, Lili: Child of Geos is a very lighthearted game with goofy humor and pleasant atmosphere.  There's not much in terms of combat other than jumping spirits and yanking flowers off of them.  It's a very nice game for relaxation and exploration because the settings are absolutely gorgeous!  Not to mention, the characters can be very quirky and even hint at references to other games such as Legend of Zelda.  Overall, if you're looking for a cute and casual indie game, this is definitely worth a shot!

review:
If you like simplistic but fun exploration and slightly cute/odd games then this is a good one. Not sure how long it is but it seems like there's at least 5+ hours in it. 

My only complaint is that sometimes when pressing E to interact/pick something up, Lili starts to walk away and go towards something else. But this is easily fixed by just double clicking the E button instead of pressing it once.

I recommend this for non-serious gamers just looking for something kind of silly to play in off time to have fun with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121105918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1436018544}
review:
Even though Lili: Child of Geos might be addressed to a younger audience it really caught me from the first second.

The Graphics are bright, atmospheric and joyful, it's so harmonic. There is no violence and there is none needed to make it a good game. It's fun to collect all achievements and explore the island and all the cute and funny characters really catch you from the very beginning.

It's also very varying that the heroine is such a casual, everyday girl, I really liked playing her.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005260241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1433538308}
review:
So I haven't given this game a full playthrough yet, but if this game does not change too much from the first two sections of the main story (and sources indicate that it doesn't), then I don't believe that I'll need to in order to justify this review. I bought this game based off positive review and what seemed to be a game with rather pretty game design from the trailers. And sure, the game is rather gorgeous on most occasions. What really bothers me, however, is that all the overworld design and assets ultimately do not play a huge role in what becomes the main goal, so there is no real incentive to explore the world at large. There are mini-quests you are able to undertake, but they are simple "just find x in this area" collection quests. Movement is alright, but there is no jumping or running, and speed boosts and special potions in this game seem kind of rough around the edges, ultimately not fitting in with the rest of the game design.

To save the spoilers, albeit the story is rather sparse and easy anyhow, you play as a graduate botanist student where the main goal of the gameplay is to jump on the backs of spirits, and by using the keys (or the xyba buttons of an xbox controller) you must grab a special flower off the spirits for your report. It's simple, cheesy at times, and vaguely child-friendly. There are constant innuendos, so I guess it's supposed to be a game for everyone, but the simplicity of the game mechanics and the lack of content reveals the game to be a simple collection time-waster for a much younger age group. And although I would recommend this game for a younger audience, this game may never challenge anyone older than 8 years old.

If you are someone who is looking for a cute puzzle platformer like I was, then do not buy this game. I'd recommend that people keep an eye on this studio, however, because it seems like they have all of the assets to make a great game, but did not deliver on anything substantial this go around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039582625', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1433672716}

author: {'steamid': '76561198121666075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1433386602}
review:
Do you crave an adventure game with a female protagonist, but Lara Crofts breast size intimidate you? Do you yearn for a graphically pleasing game like Zelda, but the puzzles and game mechanics too much for your pretty little face? 

Then "Lili: Child of Geos" will satisfy all your needs. Get it, Enjoy it, and tell Gaben that Fly sent you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995244050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1433713768}
review:
Stunningly beautiful little indie game. While easily beatable in a single sitting, Lili manages to nail several things that far more complex (and higher budget) games from bigger name studios struggle with. All the characters are interesting and memorable, the controls are elegant and simple, the writing is legitimately funny, and the social dynamics at play feel strangely believable. It even manages to have an actually realistic lead woman, a college senior working on her thesis in magic botany who has a complex family dynamic and struggles with the question of what she actually wants to do with her life now that she's on the cusp of her degree. Interactions with the game's NPCs fill out her personality wonderfully, and Lili manages to become a more developed character in the span of four hours than many games several times its length ever achieve. She even has a normally proportioned body! 

If you're into fun little puzzle games with good writing, but aren't looking for a major investment, Lily is absolutely for you. 

The only real flaw with the game is that its developers tried to be a little too pop-culture-reference-y, and especially seem to be obsessed with the Legend of Zelda series. References to Fruit Ninja mean Lili will become as strangely dated as Disney's Hercules now seems. So long as you don't mind the odd reference, though, the game is an absolute little delight.

Graphics: 10/10 (oddly gorgeous and well done for such a short, cheap game)
Music: 8/10
Writing: 9/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Overall: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197976081787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1433215283}
review:
If you are looking for a casual game that has a unique combat system, this is a good game to get.

First off some of the most notable bad features:
1. The controls starting off suck. If you are using a controller. The game does not tell you what buttons do what. All the key maps are for the keyboard. That is until you start playing and enter combat. Then they show up as the controller keys.
2. The resolution cannot be adjusted in the game. You will need to edit the config file if you are not happy with the settings. (FYI that file is filled with junk you will need to sort through).
3. The storyline starts off very pathetic and Lili just decided to do whatever everyone wants,

With those out of the way, you have a short, lighthearted adventure game. You play Lili who ends up on the island looking for flowers for her Vegi-magic college assignment. There are 3 types of inhabitants on the island. The constructs are the ones you will interact with for quests. The fish will give you general information and the spirits are the guys you need to battle to get the special flowers. The story starts off slow and progresses more about Lili's life and the freedom of the constructs. The enphasis on flowers starts to slowly go away as the quest to defeat the evil mayor takes full stage.

The combat system in this game is a bit different. Both good and annoying. You must jump on the back of the spirit and collect flowers. Once you jump on them, thorns, flowers, and bombs pop up on their backs. It is your job to hit the right button coresponding to the flowers and bombs. Get enough flowers in the timeframe and you defeat it. Fail and you just fall off and have to run back up to it and try again. There is no dying in this game so you can keep trying all you want.

The graphics are beautifully done. The locations are vivd with life. For the most part, all with the exception of a few constructs look uniquely different. The spirits look almost exactly the same but with different masks. Each location although foresty has its individual look and feel. Definitely a good looking game. I played it on my 4K tv and the resolution defaulted to that. (When you first log in the game sets the resolution to your systems max even if you do not want it to.)

The game is definitely not hard to beat and ranges from 4 to 9 hours to play depending on how many achievements you want. One thing to note is the abundance of game references and items from other games throughout the island. The dialong is quirky and not meant to be taken seriously. 

If you want a simple game that does require a little bit of action, this is a good game to get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045080783', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1433165497}
review:
Very much a kids game.
You collect flowers, break pots, open chests and occasionally do fetch quests.
You defeat enemies by jumping on their back and playing a minigame similar to fruit ninja.
There is some fun to have here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013463322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1441469014}
review:
Truly relaxing and beautiful experience. Hard to categorise the game, but it is rooted in exploration and discovery. While doing this, you pick flowers, have side quests, very basic training, collection of items...and defeat bad spirits with a cool qte.

At first I felt a clash from the typical gameplay elements you expect in games, but soon after, I grew to appreciate and enjoy Geos. Its like a spa in game form.

If your looking for something unique and appreciate a Nintendo approach to games, definately recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970470391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1419067593}
review:
Lili: Child of Geos is a third-person adventure game that screams: "Potential."

It's Zelda-esq on the surface, but offers a far more peaceful experience.
Not having to slash a sword or kill everything in sight is a welcome addition to video games.
The game world is richly animated, making it feel alive.
My only real gripe is that there are no puzzles to solve.

Pro's

+ A strong and cheerful protagonist.
+ Vibrant colorful aesthetics.
+ Energetic music.
+ Interesting cast of characters.
+ Item shop.
+ No combat.
+ Surprising story.
+ Optimized. Never ran below 60 FPS.

Con's

- No puzzles.
- Clunky Controls.
- It's a phone game.

It is well worth the 10 bucks they are asking for it.
I hope the developers can make a sequel into a full fledged game.

The sequel would offer:
* A larger world to explore.
* Mind boggling puzzles.
* Continue the "no combat" progression.
* Fully voice acted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016111736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1432230037}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029560158', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1432070047}
review:
LiL presented wonderful imagery and a vibrant living world, graphics looked great, smooth game play, and characters felt like they belonged in the world where they lived.
Although the game was a bit on the easy side, I enjoyed the ride. Game could be considered kid friendly but adults should find some of the dialog amusing as well.

Two minor complaints that should not prevent a buy: 
1) The inability to remap controls the 2 default options should handle most players. 
2) Some achievements are grinds extended far beyond what would be a full play through.

Over all a beautiful game worth checking out.

review: This game was absolutely fantastic.  It's a pretty quick play through, and the characters are so endearing that I spent time talking to each one dozens of times just because I wanted to.  It's hilarious, quirky, and a bit sentimental at times.  The mechanics are quick and fun to master, and the art direction is bright and vibrant.  This game effuses life and genuine happiness, and it's worth every penny (not just on sale either).

author: {'steamid': '76561198009671381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1528156397}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044911792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1436094450}
review:
Klare Kaufempfehlung, vor allem f√ºr nur 10 Euro und unter Ber√ºcksichtigung der 8 Stunden Spielzeit, die ich f√ºrs Hauptspiel "gebraucht" habe. Man k√∂nnte k√ºrzer spielen, wenn man sich nicht alle interessanten Upgrades leisten will, oder etwas l√§nger, wenn man alle Achievements und den besten Highscore bei jedem der 50 "Gegner" durch Rematches erreichen m√∂chte. 

Worum geht's? Die junge Protagonistin Lili erforscht eine Insel zu botanischen Zwecken, mutiert aber schnell zur Probleml√∂serin der Bewohner. Auf Geos leben h√∂lzerne beseelte Konstrukte, die von "Spirits", lebenden Pflanzenwesen, erschaffen wurden, und nun nicht nur kontrolliert, sondern auch regelrecht versklavt, manchmal sogar gemobbt werden. 

Es gilt nun mehreres zu tun: 
* nach und nach die vier Stadtviertel zu erschlie√üen und zu erkunden, inklusive zun√§chst verschlossener R√§ume, in denen sich fast immer Truhen mit (insgesamt 50) sammelbaren "Artefakten" (Alltagsgegenst√§nden oder Spielzeug) befinden
* mehrere Quests f√ºr die Konstrukte zu erledigen, die manchmal zum Schmunzeln anregen. Es sollen 45 individuelle NPCs sein, aber es vergeben leider nicht alle von ihnen Auftr√§ge, ein paar sind auch sehr kurz und simpel. F√ºr meinen Geschmack h√§tte es jedenfalls ruhig deutlich mehr und l√§ngere Quests geben k√∂nnen ;)
* es gilt auch Blumen sowie M√ºnzen zu sammeln, womit man sich Hilfsitems, Outfits und Upgrades leisten kann
* zudem bis zu 50 Spirits zu jagen und besiegen (es besteht aber kein Zwang, wirklich alle bis zum letzten zu bezwingen) 
* und nat√ºrlich den Hauptqueststrang zu verfolgen, in dem es darum geht, den Tips vom "Trainer"-Konstrukt zu folgen, wobei Lili wahlweise die drei verf√ºgbaren Skills gesteigert bekommt (bis auf zwei Slots, soda√ü man sich aussuchen kann, auf was man am ehesten verzichten kann), und nat√ºrlich zu guter Letzt die Konstrukte aus der Kontrolle der Spirits zu befreien (n√§mlich durch letztendliches Ausschalten des Kontrollturms)

Die Spirits werden "bek√§mpft", indem 
* Lili die vor ihr automatisch fliehenden Spirits verfolgt (und Rauchbomben ausweicht, die die Spirits werfen) 
* oder sich auch mal an sie anschleicht (was durch Items erleichtert wird)
* dann durch Tastaturbefehl schnell auf ihren R√ºcken springt 
* und dort angekommen den Spirits mit Mausbewegungen Blumen aus den K√∂pfen rupft, die die Spirits sprie√üen lassen (oder auch mal Rauchbomben oder Dornen)
* das Pfl√ºcken will jeweils in einer gewissen Zeitspanne erledigt sein, in der sich Lili auf dem R√ºcken der Spirits festhalten kann (durch Items verl√§ngerbar), und es sind durch Geschick mehr oder weniger Punkte/Highscores erreichbar (m√∂glichst auf die wei√üen Blumen konzentieren!)

Und das war's eigentlich auch schon. 

Die Spielwelt - ein kleiner Strand, die vier Stadtviertel mit ihrem Stra√üennetz und jeweils mehreren betretbaren H√§usern plus kleinen Verbindungsg√§ngen - ist nicht riesig, aber auch nicht allzu winzig und ausreichend abwechslungsreich. Es mangelt an freier Erkundungsfl√§che (haupts√§chlich sind es ja Stra√üen), und man kann auch schon mal mit der Figur in einem Winkel steckenbleiben, aber das Spiel zu beenden und wieder einzusteigen l√∂st solche Probleme. 

Jedes Mal, wenn man in ein anderes Stadtviertel wechselt, sprie√üen dort haupts√§chlich am Rande der Stra√üen neue wei√üe Blumen zum Sammeln (und Verkaufen), aber auch Vasen mit M√ºnzen, und eigentlich mu√ü man die nicht mal "grinden", um auch ganz nebenbei im Verlauf des Spiels - wirklich "im Vor√ºbergehen" - zu genug Geld f√ºr die wichtigsten kampferleichternden Upgrades, zur hilfreichen Karte und einem Universal-Schl√ºssel zu gelangen.

Vor allem die Musik hat es mir sehr angetan, die macht wirklich Laune und ich k√∂nnte sie mir jeden Tag anh√∂ren :) 

Sinnvoll fand ich folgende Tips, darunter eine M√∂glichkeit zur First-Person-Sicht-Umstellung, ein Link zur Liste aller H√ºte und Tips f√ºrs Besiegen der Spirits: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=284661208

Fun Fact: der Kontrollturm erinnert irgendwie an die Alien-Spires von GRAV, dem aktuellen SF-RPG von Bitmonster :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198139912927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1428784836}
review:
I'm writing this (negative) review solely because when I looked at reviews before buying this game, none of them said it was a children‚Äôs game.

It does have good parts: graphics are beautiful and having to collect a gazillion flowers brings out the hoarder in me.
Storyline, however, is too flat and too helpful, even though I've put the game on hardcore difficulty. How can one make a flower picking simulator hardcore? Beats me. The only change is that you get thrown off the spirits faster. But you can pick some more flowers and buy items to counterfeit that..

I DO recommend this for kids and anyone who just loves picking flowers and helping random wooden people.
